07740.title: IMMEDIATE NEED: 4 Girls Who Code Instructors - Starts Feb 9th & 27th (2 days/week)

07740.description: Support the Turner Syndrome Foundation & Add Marathon Experience to your resume! Complete volunteer form for this event. There is something for everyone! https://form.jotform.com/70555236438156 You may also be part of the Marathon as a participant. Sign up today! https://form.jotform.com/70045332178148 Turner Syndrome Foundation Office: 1 Bethany Rd, Bldg 1, Ste 5, Hazlet, NJ 07730 Mailing: P. O. Box 726, Holmdel, NJ 07733 Tele#: (732) 847-3385
07740.title: New Jersey Marathon 2017

07740.description: The Nonprofit Management Intern will assist the Executive Director in all aspects of nonprofit management including but not limited to strategic planning, revenue generation, public relations, event planning, and fundraising. Business management Actively engage MOCEANS’ volunteers, board members, event committees, alumni, partnering organizations, and funders Support Board of Directors, as needed Track progress and measure successes that can be effectively communicated to the board, funders, and other stakeholders Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track donor and community engagement in company database, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update company information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of members, donors, funders, and other community stakeholders Capacity-building Execute strategic business planning processes for program expansion Research prospective donors and funding sources, building strong community partnerships Expand revenue-generating and fundraising activities to support existing program operations and regional expansion Plan and support fundraising events, as needed Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Nonprofit Management Intern - Spring 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: Outreach and recruitment Proactively partner with marketing team to promote MOCEANS’ programs and services within the community Work with the marketing team to plan and execute fundraising and informational events Partner with the social media team to design and implement social media strategy Initiate speaking engagements and presentations to community organizations, schools, volunteer groups and others as necessary Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track donor and community engagement in company database, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update company information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of members, donors, funders, and other community stakeholders Development Research prospective donors and funding sources Develop program proposals for submission to grantors Identify and develop new revenue streams that are consistent with MOCEANS’ mission and strategic plan Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Development & Marketing Intern - Spring 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: Assist the Director of Independent Living in his role which includes: assisting persons with disabilities to receive appropriate services, developing connections with community organizations and service providers, and providing the five core services services to consumers in the assigned area Direct work with consumers Conduct intake and assessments of consumers seeking services through MOCEANS CIL Work with the consumer to provide the five core services: information & referral, peer support, independent living skills training, individual and systems advocacy, and transition support services Follow ­up with past consumers, as needed Outreach and recruitment Initiate speaking engagements and presentations to community organizations, schools, volunteer groups and others as necessary for recruitment purposes Proactively partner with marketing team to promote MOCEANS’ programs and services within the community Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track and document consumer progress and success in our database system, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update the information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of disability­related services and organizations General Support Cross­train with other staff members as appropriate and time­ permitting Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Independent Living Specialist Intern - Spring 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

11385.description: WE NEED THE HELP OF RELIABLE, DEDICATED, CARING PEOPLE TO HELP MAKE EVERYONE'S EXPERIENCES AT EXTREME KIDS & CREW THE BEST IT CAN BE. WE’RE ALWAYS LOOKING TO CONNECT WITH ENERGETIC, COMPASSIONATE PEOPLE. At Extreme Kids & Crew we believe that play is a powerful medium for learning, expression, and growth. Volunteers facilitate this important work by creatively engaging participants in child-led interactions that bubble up organically through openness and a genuine enthusiasm in the child's interests and ideas. Interested volunteers should be ready to get down on the floor and build castles, join in on an expedition to the moon, or just play peek-a-boo for an hour. A willingness to get silly is a must! TO APPLY: If you are interested in this opportunity, please fill out an application by following this link: http://goo.gl/forms/puXt3atBGt(link is external) If you have any questions, please email Diana Baron-Moore at dianabaronmoore@extremekidsandcrew.org
11385.title: Friday Play Partner

07508.description: My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. - A home where English is the primary language spoken -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
07508.title: Help Change the Life of an International Student, by Becoming a Host Family!

11235.description: We need someone to look over all the volunteers and organize their efforts in a collobortive and productive fashion. And to organize future volunteer efforts.
11235.title: Volunteer Organizer
11235.org: Brighton Ballet Theater / School of Russian American Ballet

06854.description: Family & Children's Agency is seeking individuals to make a difference in the lives of middle school students by volunteering in FCA's ASPIRE after school program starting this September 2016. Come join a dynamic team of committed volunteers who provide guidance and homework help at FCA's program located on the campus of Norwalk Community College from 3:30 to 5:30 p.m. during the academic year. No experience is necessary and volunteers can choose to volunteer one afternoon a week, Monday through Friday for a minimum of three months (academic year preferred). Adults and high school students are eligible for volunteering. Fridays will purely be academics from 3:30 - 4:30. Program Information Family & Children’s Agency seeks to improve the lives of Norwalk’s middle school youth by enabling their successful transition into high school and increasing their ability to be productive, independent young adults. This is accomplished by providing a safe and structured community-based After School Program for students to improve academic performance, develop character, and promote healthy peer interactions and lifestyles. The program operates on the school calendar and does not offer programs during holidays and vacations. Requirements To become a volunteer in the After School Program, volunteers must complete an application and necessary background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers must also complete an Agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with the After School Program staff. Family & Children’s Agency expects volunteers to commit to one afternoon a week for a minimum of three months. However, volunteers are encouraged to commit for the academic year. Many volunteers have seasonal activities or commitments and time off can be arranged to accommodate these activities. Skills Needed: Positive role model Desire to work with children Patience Good judgment Dependability/consistency Cultural sensitivity/awareness Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries Clean background check Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency.
06854.title: After School Homework Helpers & Program Support Volunteers Needed!

06854.description: Volunteers Needed for the Relay For Life of Greenwich 2016-2017! Relay For Life is the American Cancer Society's signature fundraising event and is the number one fundraiser aimed at eliminating cancer in the world. Each year, four million people at over 6,000 events in 24 countries participate in this walk to fight against this disease that takes too much from too many. Relay For Life events raise critical funds that fuel the mission of the American Cancer Society, an organization that touches the lives of so many. Relay For Life events not only raise money for cancer research, but for services that focus on improving a cancer patient's quality of life as well as cancer prevention and early detection programs. The Relay of Life of Greenwich is looking for some passionate, energetic, movers and shakers to become a part of our Event Leadership Team! This team plans and executes the Relay For Life of Greenwich. Event logistics, recruiting teams to join us on the track, marketing the event, planning our cancer survivor reception, creating and facilitating event ceremonies, scheduling entertainment and activities - these are just a few of the many opportunities and responsibilities taken on by our team of dedicated volunteers aimed at eliminating cancer once and for all! It only takes a LITTLE time and a BIG heart! Being on the Event Leadership team involves... 1. Attending planning meetings once a month 2. Spreading the word about Relay 3. Encouraging people to sign-up 4. Coming up with creative ideas 5. Planning fundraisers 6. Helping with the event day-of 7. Having FUN! If you have a passion to end cancer, then please join us by filling out our Survey at http://www.relayforlifegreenwich.org/ (takes 5 mintes!) or contacting Grace Scinto at grace.scinto@cancer.org. Join us in helping create a world with more birthdays and less cancer!
06854.title: Volunteers Needed for the Relay For Life of Greenwich 2017!

10580.description: Volunteers are needed for a variety of tasks before, during and after the event. Opportunities include: cheering, clean up, kids' activities, mission area, musical entertainment, parking/traffic management, photographer, refreshments, registration, rest/water stop, safety/route marshal, set-up, team meeting/photos, etc. If you would like to be more involved, there are always opportunities to join our planning committee. Please register online at: http://2017westchesterwalk.kintera.org/
10580.title: Westchester Pancreatic Cancer Research Walk

10583.description: Immediate openings: Volunteer with the Greenburgh Nature Center to assist in curriculum development, staffing, and assessment of our new \"Explore, Discover, Connect\", a unique nature immersion program for kindergartners utilizing the many varied ecosystems and outdoor learning opportunities on our 33 acre nature preserve. Volunteers will be required to attend 1 day of orientation and training during the week of September 19 - 23 (to be scheduled). Regular hours will be a combination of Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays from 12 noon to 4 pm starting September 27 through December 22, 2016, with possible extension into Spring. Volunteer candidates can be students of early childhood/elementary education or related fields, with a strong interest in nature-based learning. Volunteers will collaborate directly with Greenburgh Nature Center naturalist educators who consider it part of our mission to support the academic and career goals of our volunteers.
10583.title: Nature-Based Early Childhood Teacher’s Assistant

06851.description: The Courage to Speak Foundation, is a Norwalk-based non-profit organization dedicated to keeping our children safe from drugs. We have several volunteer opportunities available and are currently seeking enthusiastic adult and student volunteers to assist with our upcoming media event, The 13th Annual Courage to Speak Empowering Youth to be Drug Free Family Night. Volunteers are needed for checking in guests, setting up the event, overseeing the dinner, babysitting and more. For more information, contact Ginger Katz at 203 831 9700 or gkatz@couragetospeak.org. Please visit www.couragetospeak.org for more information. Serving dinner, registratlion, setting up student posters at the event, greeting participants, cleaning up after dinner, setting up event and more.
06851.title: Courage to Speak Empowering Youth to be Drug Free Family Night 2017

07054.description: Seeking a volunteer or student looking for experience to serve as a Class Aide within our community diabetes education classes. Our foundation offers interactive, educational classes (along with free healthy dinner) to the community, and an Aide is needed to help participants complete paperwork, help nurses get health screenings completed, help serve meals, and assist with general handouts. You will work directly with dietitians and the class moderator. This is a great opportunity to be involved directly with public health and community education, including gaining nutrition and nursing information that could be valuable for you. This is also a great opportunity for someone with diabetes who wants to help others! We only ask that you assist one evening per month, from 5:30pm until a little after 7pm (last Wednesday of each month) from April until November 2017. Must commit to entire block of classes for continuity. Please apply asap if interested!
07054.title: Student or Volunteer To Serve as Aide in Monthly Diabetes Classes

11701.description: PAC - Office Assistant (14 hours per week) Mon -Fri - 9:30am-1:30pm About the position: We are seeking dedicated self-starters to work with the CEO of Parent Action Community Inc.(PAC) in Amityville NY. We offer a welcoming work environment and the ability to learn and grow in a supportive atmosphere. As the office Assistant, you will be a part of having an impact on the Amityville and surrounding community with a non-profit organization. About Parent Action Community: Parent Action Community (PAC) was established in 2005 by parents concerned with the behavior and condition of today's youth. We are a fully-accredited 501(c) (3) charity equipping young adults for the responsibility of leadership. PAC’s goals are to Equip, Empower, and Educate \"At-Risk\" Youth And Young Adults between the ages of 13 and 24. We develop their Knowledge, Personal Skills, and Motivation to Reduce Adolescent Pregnancies, High School Dropout Rates, Sexually Transmitted Diseases, including HIV/AIDS, Substance Abuse, Juvenile Delinquencies, and Reduction In Crimes through a Comprehensive, Community-Wide Collaborative Effort to Improve Academic Achievement in order to be Career and College-prepared. Our Volunteers have a unique opportunity to gain valuable campaigning and nonprofit experience, cultivate your interests in social equality, strengthen your understanding of a fast-paced campaign organization, and gain critical organization skills and experience. PAC’s reputation of providing services to the Amityville and surrounding community has grown over the last 10 years. We are looking to expand the organization and programs in the future. The role of Office assistant is to support the organization by overseeing the office during High School Diploma program, the distribution center and the tutoring programs. The Office Assistant will be responsible for the following: Preparing weekly reports on the activities in the PAC center during their volunteer hours. Ensure that all visitors sign in and complete a PAC \"in-need\" form. Prepare a weekly report on visitors. Prepare a weekly report on items that PAC was unable to supply. Preparing weekly reports on volunteer hours. Track number of program recipients. Provide a weekly report on attendance Prepare a monthly report for the CEO Review all Outgoing correspondences Qualifications: * Demonstrated commitment to Youth and Community projects; * Excellent written and verbal communication skills; * Good organizational skills, attention to detail, professional demeanor and the ability to juggle several tasks while meeting deadlines; * Experience or interest in non-profits an advantage;
11701.title: Volunteer Office Assistant

11701.description: Position name: ESL Tutor Sundays 3-6pm Parent Action Community Inc. is looking for ESL Volunteer to provide classroom and administrative support in our Youth/Adult Basic Education program. No experience is required. This position offers the opportunity to teach all levels of ESL, and provide administrative support to our office management. Main duties: * Teaching Weekly English lessons to youth and adults of other Language (All levels) and developing lesson plans and assessing learning progress of program participants * Evaluate and report progress in English proficiency of ESL participants * Tutoring High School Equivalency Program participants with their English homework for Advanced ESL Participants * Supporting office staff with ESL-related tasks, eg: translating for participants, English documents and website to other languages. * Assist with community outreach activities as needed Preferred: ESL Certified Instructor but not required Website: www.pac4success.org
11701.title: ESL Volunteer Tutor

11743.description: Do you want to educate, motivate and have a blast all while volunteering to promote healthy living and well-being? There is an opportunity waiting for your encouraging voice and energetic personality. You would get the chance to offer your services of Yoga, Tai chi, Pilate's, Floor Exercise Routines, Nutrition Information or Aromatherapy for those living with mental illness or substance abuse issues. This is a great opportunity to teach those who suffer from substance abuse, other coping mechanisms and ways to reduce stress naturally. It is also a great way to build experience in your field.
11743.title: Health and Wellness Professional Volunteer

11743.description: Concierge Volunteer Are you looking for experience in customer service? This is your opportunity to welcome, direct and make that first great impression for our patients & families. Individuals must possess the following: Ability to volunteer a minimum 4hour shift per week Compassionate communication skills Ability to be on your feet for 4 hours Work under the direction of our Lead Concierge
11743.title: Huntington Hospital Main Lobby Concierge

11743.description: We are looking for dedicated volunteers with excellent customer service skills to perform follow up phone calls for our patients after they leave the hospital. In this role, you would work closely with the health care team and connect with people at a vulnerable time in their life to ensure that their discharge needs are being addressed. We are seeking compassionate, well spoken individuals who love people, are at least 20 years of age and able to donate 3-4 hours weekly.
11743.title: Patient Outreach Volunteer

07059.description: The Growing to Give Program (GGP), Wagner Farm Arboretum (WFA) Education Committee, and Warren Township schools collaborate to produce vegetables for donation, educate students in organic gardening skills, encourage student awareness of local poverty, and offer them the opportunity to serve through volunteerism. WFA supply training and publicity materials and teachers incorporate nature lessons in the classroom. Elementary students will grow 4 seedlings of selected vegetables in the classroom and at planting time will go to the Giving Garden and plant their seedlings with advice of teachers and experienced gardeners The children will experience an educational/service field trip day to WFAF where they will learn about bee keeping, the story of Wagner Farm Arboretum, as well as perform volunteer service for Giving Garden, Children’s Garden, and the Growing to Give program. Responsibilities and schedule 32 hours - Flexible schedule during end of March, Prepare for program working with school representative and arboretum personnel. Enlist 4 to 6 gardeners to volunteer as advisors on seed planting day. 8 hour day - One day in early April - Planting at school, Include a short informative presentation for each group. Oversee volunteers supervising the planting, labeling, and watering. Each class takes its plant trays to classroom. 12 hours - Periodically check in with classes as to progress of the seedlings. 8 hours - Prepare for school field trip. Identify and schedule presentations and work assignments. Collaborate with school officials and Arboretum leaders. 8 hour day - One day(mid May) during Implement the field trip plan. 6 hours - Pick up and transfer the seedlings from the school to the cold frame in Giving Garden area. 16 hours - Maintain and improve the seedling quality and verify plots are ready for planting. 6 hours - Insure that volunteer gardeners are available to supervise on planting day. 8 hour day - one day(last week of May or first week of June). Oversee the planting. Approximately 16 classes will participate arriving by bus trips of 4 classes per trip.
07059.title: Growing to Give Program Facilitator

07059.description: Planning Provide ideas & goals for upcoming season (plantings, projects, plans, ideas for corporate volunteers and plans) Create a plan on how to accomplish goals for the year (corporations volunteers, budget money, projects) Compile a budget for upcoming year to present to Board of Trustees. Pull together an annual report including budget for last season to close out year. Budget & Reporting NOTE: Budgets from previous years are available to use as a template Contact potential volunteers. Manage volunteer activities for individuals and groups. Volunteers NOTE: Plans from previous years are available on how to organize corporate events Garden Management (includes area in front of Office) Put out decorations and signs in garden for new season (letters for ABC garden, fairy garden decorations, sings for fairy garden and ABC garden) Prepare beds with mulch, begin planting annuals Water areas where sprinklers have not been installed. Maintain overall Children’s Garden appearance and front of office. Includes weeding and deadheading. Management of perennials by ensuring the growth and spread is maintained. Fall cleanup. Remove annuals. Cut back perennials. Store signs and decorations in the shed.
07059.title: Children’s Garden Administrator

07052.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 8 AM - 12 PM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Clean-up Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 7 AM - 11 AM Clean-up: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. 8 AM - 2 PM Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. 8 AM - 2 PM For more information, visit: www.walkms.org
07052.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2017 West Orange!
07052.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07201.description: Volunteers needed to help staff sites on particular evening for Operation Warm Heart, our winter homeless shelter program that runs from 12/1-3/31. The sites which are at various local churches host 14 adults so they have a warm place to spend the night during the cold winter months, There are 2 volunteers at each site at all times for the times you are there. Training will be provided.
07201.title: Operation Warm Heart Volunteers Needed!
07201.org: Elizabeth Coalition to House the Homeless

07201.description: Help homeless or at risk of being homeless children achieve better in school. We are in great need of enthusiastic individuals who can motivate children to learn.
07201.title: Volunteer for Afterschool Program for homeless/ at risks of being homeless children.
07201.org: Elizabeth Coalition to House the Homeless

07207.description: We are looking for a media intern to do the following: Two Days a Week Only!!! Can work 5-6 hour shifts Socail Media News letters Email Blasts Photography videos Blogging We are non profit organization and we give out scholarships to high students who want to attend college. So if fit the criteria above is you then we want you on our team. All events are not located in ELizabeth, but you must be willing travel and to stay on board for at least 6 months. Schedule is flexible some nights and weekends for events only Join us and as we help our youth who are the future leaders of tomorrow www.uprisingstarsinc.org
07207.title: Media Intern

07207.description: We are looking for a dependadalbe and reliable individuals to asssit with the following. For TWO Days a Week!!! Only Can work 5-6 hour shifts. 1. Making phones calls 2. Sending emails 3. Powe Point Presentations 4. Ressearching 5. Following up 6. Asssinting with presentations for Career Day at high schools We are looking for people that want to gain more experince in working with a non profit organization and has great computer skills and who is a team player and loves helping youth. Serious inquiries only.
07207.title: Administrative Assistant Intern

07207.description: Serious inquirels only!! Must have 4- 6 hours max a week to give, be committed to our mission, and effiticely communitate witht the fournders!!!! Looking to make an impact on the world? Than join our team. Up Rising Stars Inc. is actively seeking interested and qualified individuals to join our Board of Directors. Board members advise, govern, oversee policy and direction, advocate and fundraise on behalf of us to support the organization’s mission and needs. Board members have a direct and significant impact in improving the lives of the people and families we assist. The mission is to assist young people by providing them resources that will contribute to a higher education so they can achieve success. General Expectations: board members are expected to meet certain standards of board behavior and conduct as outlined below. 1. Know the vision, mission, purposes, goals, policies, programs, services, strengths and needs. 2. Term: Minimum of two years 3. Attend board meetings 4. Keep abreast with trends in the charity sector and other factors that will affect the work us 5. Maintain independence and objectivity and exercise fairness, integrity and ethics in the execution of their duties. 6 Represent us publicly and seek to promote the image and interests whenever appropriate. 7. The board of directors meets bimonthly. Board members are expected to attend all meetings. 8. Read the minutes of meetings and supporting materials 9. Maintain confidentiality of the Board meeting sessions, and support the final majority decision on issues discussed Financial Responsibilities: * Be personally responsible for giving or getting at least $5,000 annually. This can be given personally or by getting others to give in a number of ways. All Board Members must pay dues of 250.00 annually. Qualifications: * Previous experience as a Board Member or a Board Advisor a plus. * Experience in Finance, Accounting, Fundraising, Non-Profit Management, Business Development or Management, Grant Writing, Law, or Marketing and Communications. Experience working internationally a plus. * Established professional and leader in given field of expertise with a network of contacts and ability and willingness to leverage them in support of Up Rising Stars Inc. * Passion for empowerment, entrepreneurship, education, and poverty alleviation. * Ability to attend monthly board meetings * Ability to think critically, plan strategically and remain mission-focused in all decision making processes. * Must maintain confidentiality. * Ability to execute assignments and meet deadlines. * Must have strong organizational, communication, networking, and follow-up skills.
07207.title: Board of Director

10111.description: The National MS Society New York City-Southern New York Chapter is looking for volunteers to help with our upcoming event - Climb to the Top! Climb to the Top will be held on Sunday, March 5th at Rockefeller Center. This is a unique event that the New York City - Southern New York Chapter of the National MS Society hosts to raise awareness and funds for the 12,000 people living with MS that they serve in the five boroughs and Westchester, Putnam, Rockland, Orange and Sullivan counties. Groups and individuals of all ages and abilities are invited to volunteer. We are always looking for youth clubs, corporate and service-oriented community groups to lend a hand before, during, and after our events. There is only one requirement: a desire to end MS now! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the positions below and register online here: http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR?fr_id=28095&pg=informational&sid=13793 Climb to the Top - Volunteer Positions Pre-Event Set-up Team: Date : Saturday, March 4, 2017 Shift: 9:00am-1:00pm Description: Volunteers will assist with the setup of tables, chairs, materials and signage. You must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and climb numerous flights of stairs. No seated positions are available. Event Information Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-10:00am Description:Volunteers will answer participant questions and direct them to various event areas. Attendance at a training session will be required. Participant Support Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: Various Shifts Description: Volunteers will provide support to various participant areas including, but not limited to: Bag Check, Start Line, Rest Stops, Food & Beverage and Top Fundraiser Lounge. Photography Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:30am-11:00am (Finish Line - Top of the Rock) 6:00am-10:00am (Sponsor Photos) Volunteers will choose one shift* Description: Volunteers will take photos of participants at the finish line at the Top of the Rock as well as photos of event sponsors and general atmosphere. Muscle Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-11:00am Description: Volunteers will assist with moving barricades, tables, chairs and other heavy objects and hanging/removal of signs and banners. No seated positions are available. Spirit Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-9:00am (1st Shift) 8:00am-11:00am (2nd Shift) Volunteers will choose one shift* Description: Volunteers will cheer for the participants as they cross the finish line. Volunteers are asked to bring lots of enthusiasm, spirit and cheer! Stair Support Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-11:00am Description: This team will be stationed in the stairwell to ensure the safety of our participants and cheer them on! All volunteers must be able to stand for long periods of time and climb numerous flights of stairs. No seated positions are available Volunteer Check-in: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 4:30am-10:00am Description: Volunteers will check-in volunteers and direct them to assigned locations. Attendance at a training session is required. If you have any questions, please contact: Amber Young - Manager, Volunteer Engagement/Logistics at Amber.Young@nmss.org or 212-453-3258
10111.title: Volunteer for Climb to the Top!
10111.org: National MS Society - New York City

08807.description: Help an adult to read, write, and communicate in English. Become literacy tutor! Training provided. Literacy Volunteers of Somerset County is looking for volunteers to become Basic Literacy and English as a Second Language (ESL) tutors. Volunteers must complete a 15-hour training course during 5 class sessions. Upon completion of training, tutors will be matched with students. Tutoring is usually held at the local libraries in Somerset County. The schedule for our next Tutor Training class is as follows: Mondays, April 24 through May 22, 2017 from 6-9pm. To learn more about becoming a tutor, information sessions will be held at local library branches in April. See the following link for dates and times: http://www.literacysomerset.org/index.php/tutor-information-sessions Training takes place at the PeopleCare Center, 120 Finderne Ave., Bridgewater. There is a $50 charge for training materials. Please visit our website at Literacysomerset.org for details. To register for training, please visit http://literacysomerset.org/index.php/tutor-online-registration
08807.title: Become a Literacy Tutor - Change Someone's Life

11021.description: The Village of Great Neck Plaza is seeking volunteers to assist on its Senior Span Program, which provides projects and programs for our senior citizens. We are looking for volunteers to \"Call a Friend,\" making contact with one of our shut in seniors for companionship and friendship. Other similar tasks need volunteers, such as helping a senior with an arts & craft project, reading poetry to seniors, assiting in errands, etc. There are also seminars held regularly at Village Hall. Each seminar is on a separate topic focusing on health, nutrition, aging issues, managing finances, and general senior education. Candidates must have professional expertise in an area and be comfortable with public speaking. For further information, please contact Mayor's Assistant, at (516) 482-4500, or mayorsassistant@greatneckplaza.net.
11021.title: Senior Span Volunteers

10452.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning. The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10452.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (Metropolitan Charter School, Bronx)

11102.description: We are an innovative senior center serving brunch to older adults on Saturdays in Astoria. We are in need of a front desk receptionist who can greet members, get everyone passing to sign in, sell lunch tickets, answer an occasional phone call and do light clerical work. Ideally two persons will be at the desk at all times. All are encouraged to apply but persons speaking Greek, Spanish or another language would be particularly helpful.
11102.title: SATURDAY Receptionist, Senior Citizen Brunch Program

11102.description: Pianist Needed for Senior Chorus in Astoria HANAC Innovative SS Choral group \"The HANAC Harmonizers\" is seeking a volunteer accompanist for weekly rehearsals and semi-annual performances. We currently use karaoke tracks and would like to begin working with live accompaniment. We sing popular music, jazz standards, Broadway, 50’s and Motown. We meet on Tuesdays from 10:30-11:30am. Please contact me if this sounds like something you would be interested in and if you have time once a week or twice a month. Thank you
11102.title: Pianist Needed for Senior Chorus in Astoria

11102.description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. We are looking for a Civics/Citizenship instructor to teach twice per week. Our classes generally have less than 10 students who range in English proficiency from beginner to intermediate. We are looking for a self-starter who is comfortable with diversity and can make the class interesting and fun. The primary responsibilities are: Preparing students for the Naturalization test and interview Incorporating US History and Government in their lessons Strengthening speaking, reading, and writing skills needed for the test Requirements: Available Monday and Wednesday mornings from 10:30 am - 12 pm (afternoon/evening availability can be considered) Able to devote 3 months minimum Minimum 3 rd year BA in history, political science, government (or if not studying these subjects can explain why they would make a great teacher!) Experience teaching English a HUGE plus! How to apply: Please send a cover letter and resume to Ms. Devon Stein at volunteer@cianainc.org. Please include the position title in the subject line of the application.
11102.title: Volunteer Civics Instructor
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: We are looking for energetic and committed individuals who have a passion for working with children and helping them succeed academically. Tutors will patiently work through homework assignments, guiding students through hard-to-grasp concepts, ensuring that homework assignments are completed, adequate test prep is provided and a mentor relationship is established. We are looking for tutors who can commit to tutor both Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 5.30-7 pm.
11102.title: Elementary School After-School Tutors
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11377.description: Sunnyside Community Services, based in Queens, New York, offers a range of life-enhancing programs that benefit approximately 14,000 individuals per year. From Early Childhood Education to Senior Services, we provide programs for all ages. Our services include: pre-kindergarten and after school programs; college prep and career programs for teens and young adults; Our after-school programs provide fun and challenging enrichment activities for your children. We provide after-school programs at P.S. 150 and P.S. 199 in Sunnyside for elementary school students (grades K - 5). Programs for middle school students (grades 6 - 8) are available at SCS’ main site and at the Boulevard Family Residence in Elmhurst. The Sunnyside Cornerstone Program at Woodside Houses provides opportunities for children, teenagers, and adults to participate in structured after-school programs and drop-in activities including performing arts and music, athletics, computers, reading, chess, and more. Our Needs: Volunteer Tutors What We’re Looking For Volunteers to do Lead tutoring sessions while supported by staff Support participants with homework completion and a subject of your choice, including: English, Math, Science, and Social Studies; Serve as a role model and build positive relationships with youth; Strong background in one or more of the following academic subjects: English, Math, Science, and/or Social Studies Previous experience working with youth; Posses enthusiasm and patience Strong oral communication skills Ability to make weekly commitments Previous tutoring experience (a plus) At least one 2 hour to 2.5 hour session per week, Monday-Thursday. Times vary between 3:30 pm to 5:30 pm, based on youth/volunteer and program schedules. 11377.description: DESCRIPTION OF PROJECT / PURPOSE OF ASSIGNMENT: Woodside on the Move holds regular fundraising events often featuring New York State elected officials Events can range from sit down meals to lectures. WOTM needs assistance maintaining our client database and OUTLINE OF VOLUNTEER’S RESPONSIBILITIES: Volunteers will typically asked to assist with general filing/organization of WOTM’S files across various departments. Volunteers will occasionally be asked to perform clerical duties, specifically faxing,copying, and notarizing material upon request. TIME COMMITMENT: Administrative volunteers will typically be asked to commit at least 2-4 hours per month. Schedule will be determined based on volunteers availability. Volunteers are welcome to offer their services as frequent as they wish. Volunteers are required to notify their coordinator 24 hours prior to their proposed volunteer shift. QUALIFICATIONS : Qualifications vary, depending on specific tasks/events BENEFITS: Volunteers will be part of the decision-making body of a neighborhood organization that has been providing after school and affordable housing for four decades, which support critical programs that are LIFELINES for Queens’ families. Depending on the type of event, volunteers may be able to attend the event free of charge or at a reduced price. All WOTM volunteers receive the WOTM’s newsletter in addition to, receiving recognition on WOTM’s social media handles and on our published works . Event volunteers also have the opportunity to learn skills from professionals, while fostering healthy community engagement. For all inquiries, please send resume and brief cover letter via email. Contact Aaron Frager at afrager@woodsideonthemove.org or call at (718)-476-8449.

11101.description: Welcome to our ESL Practice Program at The English Language Center! The ESL Practice Program needs volunteers to assist our adult English language students with small group conversation practice or one-on-one writing tutoring. Evening Conversation Groups: When: Wednesdays and Thursdays, February 1st - March 15th Time: 5:45PM to 6:45PM Evening Writing Partners: When: Monday - Thursday, February 6th - March 15th Time: 5:45PM to 6:45PM Afternoon Conversation Groups: When: Tuesdays and Thursdays, January 24th - March 16th Time: 1:00PM to 2:15PM Afternoon Writing Partners: When: Mondays and Wednesdays, January 25th - March 15th Time: 1:00PM to 2:15PM The aim of Co nversation Groups is to further our students' speaking and listening skills. Many of our students live with family or friends and don't get to practice these skills outside of class. Writing Partners, on the other hand, help individual students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as help students improve their overall writing skills. Volunteers are asked to commit only one hour per week, though we are happy to have you more often if you like. Our students are very motivated and fun to work with, and they are very appreciative of any help you can give. Please contact Marek Pena at marpena@lagcc.cuny.edu for more information.

From Early Childhood Education to Senior Services, we provide programs for all ages. Our services include: pre-kindergarten and after school programs; college prep and career programs for teens and young adults; Our after-school programs provide fun and challenging enrichment activities for your children. We provide after-school programs at P.S. 150 and P.S. 199 in Sunnyside for elementary school students (grades K - 5). Programs for middle school students (grades 6 - 8) are available at SCS’ main site and at the Boulevard Family Residence in Elmhurst. The Sunnyside Cornerstone Program at Woodside Houses provides opportunities for children, teenagers, and adults to participate in structured after-school programs and drop-in activities including performing arts and music, athletics, computers, reading, chess, and more. 11771.description: CCH’s Afterschool Enrichment Program is a program that helps support students from grades K - 6th. The majority of these students come from homes where English is not the first language spoken, and as a result parents often do not understand English sufficiently to help them with their homework and other academic activities. Through the program we hope to develop responsible youths for the community, and help foster the skills necessary for them to succeed in school, participate in extra-curricular activities, and increase their chances to attend a college or university. Since we are a non-profit, we ask for the help of those in our community to achieve this goal. We need volunteers/mentors to donate their time to help these students. The program is held Monday through Friday (school calendar) from 3:00PM to 5:30Pm in Oyster Bay. We are also looking for volunteers to help tutor the 7th-12th grade ESL students in our program that could use the extra study time and regents prep. That would take place in our office in Oyster Bay and could be done any weekday after 6pm. THIS IS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY FOR A HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT LOOKING TO VOLUNTEER!
11771.title: Volunteers Needed for Homework Help and Tutoring at After School Program
11771.org: CENTRO CULTURAL HISPANO DE OYSTER BAY EAST NORWICH

07757.description: Move For Hunger is looking for runners and walkers to help us turn miles into meals at the New Jersey Marathon, 1/2 Marathon & 5K! Team members receive a free race entry, training help and some stylish running gear. By joining Team Move For Hunger, you can help us race away hunger and food waste one mile at a time. WHAT DO MY DONATIONS DO? By becoming a member of Team Move For Hunger, your fundraising donations go to keep the food banks in America stocked and meals on the table. Our network of relocation industry specialists help to reduce food waste and deliver much needed food to our local food banks when people are moving. With over 6 million Americans that are food insecure, your help is needed more than ever. And since 96% of every dollar donated going back to our hunger relief and food rescue programs, you can be assured that your miles are turned into meals for those in need. In the last six years, our network of movers have delivered over 7 million pounds of food - let's keep it moving! HOW DOES THE TEAM WORK? Great question! All you need to do is fill out our online registration form and our Team Captain Emily will send over some fundraising and training tips, along with a link to create your personal fundraising page on Crowdrise. Upload your personal picture and information and you’re ready to go! Gather donations from friends, family, coworkers and anyone who wants to help us fight hunger in America. You’ll receive bi-monthly newsletters filled with great information to help you cross the finish line, all while your fundraising donations enable us to continue our lifesaving services. Once you’ve raised the minimum, we will register you with the race, getting your free registration along with a stylish Team Move For Hunger technical tee or tank top (your choice). If you raise more, the incentives just get better! WANT MORE INFORMATION? Contact our Team Captain Emily at emily@moveforhunger.org, call 732.832.5025 or visit: https://moveforhunger.org/event/new-jersey-marathon-12-marathon-5k-april-30-2017/
07757.title: Volunteers Needed to Turn Miles Into Meals at the New Jersey Marathon, 1/2 Marathon & 5K!

07040.description: When you help an adult learn to read and write, you help an entire family. Literacy can lead to a job, a better job, the ability to read to one’s children, help with their homework and read correspondence sent home from school. It can lead to a driver’s license, a high school diploma or equivalency, to citizenship, to a better life. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we help adults achieve all of those things. But we need your help: We need more volunteers to teach Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages. No teaching experience or knowledge of a second language is required, just a desire to help. We are plumbers and secretaries, job seekers, administrators, retired teachers, journalists, even a former Peace Corps member or two. Our students are from the United States and more than 150 other countries - from Albania to Zimbabwe. Many are waiting for help. A great way to help is to join our tutor training workshop in Maplewood, which meets on six Monday and Thursday afternoons at the Hilton Branch of the Maplewood Memorial Library, 1:00-4:00 pm, April 3, 6, 10, 13, 17, 20, 2017. Attendance at all sessions is highly recommended. It’s not too late to help improve the life of an adult and his or her family. For more information, visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call our office at the Bloomfield Public Library at 973-566-6200, ext. 217.
07040.title: Help an adult learn to read, help an entire family
07040.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07940.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07940.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike

06880.description: CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has background in strategic marketing, which ideally includes a blend of marketing planning and execution, with direct experience at an advertising agency or on the client side, with branding, advertising and communications experience. Advocacy experience is also highly regarded. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide - including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, members, collaborating organizations and legislators as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Excellent written and verbal skills are a must. Responsibilities to include the following: Collaborating with the Executive Director and Board leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive marketing and communications plan employing strategies that will broaden programmatic reach and deepen impact, including hands-on experience with all appropriate aspects of social media Managing the ongoing promotion of major programs and developing and executing messaging for new initiatives Identifying and crafting stories that communicate the essence of the organization’s mission and successes Working with the technology-development team to identify a set of meaningful touchpoints with our targets - new member joining, annual pledging - and creating an array of appropriate communications to be automated and sent, in order to stay current and ensure maximum engagement and support from our stakeholders. Working with all CAG committees, specifically including Development and Programming, to assist with execution of their annual plans and to help further corporate engagement efforts Identifying significant media and public policy issues that can be leveraged to support CAG’s work, and creating and implementing plans to exploit them
06880.title: Connecticut Association for the Gifted - BOD Opening in Marketing/Advertising

Attributes * Individuals of affluence and/or influence in the community * Strong interest in fundraising and charitable giving * Well respected in the community and/or their individual networks * Goal oriented * Has an affinity for Be The Match mission Responsibilities** ** in collaboration with Development Manager and Be The Match Foundation * Actively engage in raising $5,000 in sponsorship, attendees and/or contributions * Collaborate with BoA to identify and coordinate fundraising asks * Support the mission and activities of Be The Match Foundation as a representative, relationship builder and recognition provider * Promote Soiree event through personal and professional network * Identify additional leaders to join BoA * Attend monthly BoA meetings * Provide input and ownership in the Be The Match Soiree development plan Our Board of Ambassadors will be recognized at the Be The Match Soiree, on our Be The Match Soiree materials program and the Be The Match Annual Report.

Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. 11201.description: A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply : please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11201.title: Director of Development

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year, we are seeking a highly skilled Programs Coordinator to support our children and can commit 15-20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. Responsibilities: The Volunteer will assist the Programs Director with any research, projects, reaching out to individuals in/outside of the organization. Creating templates, documents, spreadsheets, etc for the programs department to run more efficiently. Understanding the role of the Programs Director, putting all information on the calendar for Director. Overall Responsibilities: -Writing Emails for Programs Director. -Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. -Researching topics for Director. -Assisting with any work Programs Director may give assistant. -Creating files, potentially sharing information with other volunteers/interns. -Creating Calendar appointments. -Reaching out to schools, hospitals, children programs, etc. -Using the phone, computer, laptop, iPad etc. Competencies: - Has experience with children between the ages 4 -18. -Knowledge of Google Documents/apps. -Must be working towards a bachelor degree in psychology, Programs, or have a minimum of 1 year of assistant related work. -Highly organized. -Great communication and self-motivated.

Your passion and dedication will directly lead to more young people getting the arts opportunities they deserve. Overall Responsibilities: Carry out any responsibilities the Administrative Department may have. Provide administrative support and ensure a smooth running of daily operations by arranging communication between all departments and all managers and the Executive Director. Responsibilities: Serve as liaison between the president and head of departments to ensure mutual understanding of tasks, goals, and agendas. Remains in constant contact with the head of departments. Updates calendars, agendas, and supporting documents on a daily basis. Organizing, storing, and managing files. Coordinate and participate in department meetings and follow up on action items. Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. Competencies: Understanding of Microsoft Office and Google drive, including Google + Administrative and/or bookkeeping experience. Ability to work as part of a team within a fast paced environment. Excellent communication, both written and oral, skills. Ability to pay attention to detail.
11201.title: Administration Assistant

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year and in order to help as many kids as possible we are seeking a highly skilled volunteer/intern fundraiser for the new year, 2017. Your passion and dedication will directly lead to more young people getting the arts opportunities they deserve. Overall Responsibilities: Assisting Fundraising Coordinator/VP of Fundraising with any job-related task for Fundraising assistant. Consisting of, but not limited to: scheduling appointments for Fundraising Coordinator, assisting in reaching out to donors, supporters for companies, researching information, creating documents, sending emails, setting up meetings with other department heads, reaching out to other departments for information. Responsibilities: Supports Candidate Fundraising Director in organizing meetings, staffing events and preparing materials Prepares donor meeting and event materials as necessary Plays lead role in scheduling for the department Make phone calls and send emails to lists of identified prospective donors, including keeping track of the call history. Help develop other lists of potential donors where the names are known but not contact information. Internet searching Keeping consistent relations with donors and future donors/sponsors. Assists in the development of Brochures, flyers, posters, etc. Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. Meet at least once per week meet with Fundraising Coordinator. Competencies: Understanding of Google Docs Understanding of Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc. Friendly phone personality, etiquette on being able to write emails. Highly organized. Experience with Internet Searching. Ability to multitask and help manage a few projects at once.
11201.title: Fundraising Assistant

We are seeking a Marketing VP who can commit 5-10 hours per week for a minimum of 4 months. Responsibilities: Assisting the Marketing Coordinator with any Job responsibilities. Contacting potential donors/sponsors to help out the organization. Following organization protocol when it comes to emails/phone calls. Using templates within google drive to contact companies, also sharing folders with volunteers/interns. Researching/assisting with any job-related tasks available to the assistant for review. Overall Responsibilities: -Emailing donors/sponsors. -Researching information. -Assisting Coordinator/Director with any job duties. -Ability to create templates/sharing potentially with other volunteers/interns and also outside vendors. -Keeping records of donors/sponsors. -Emailing other people with proper email etiquette. -Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. Competencies: -Has/working towards in degree in Marketing or related field. -Excellent communication skills. -Understanding of Google docs and Microsoft Office.
11201.title: Marketing VP- Volunteer

Responsible for collecting, assembling, and selecting sound recordings, to prepare for the final verse of music. Responsibilities -Understanding of acoustics, sound recording processes and electronics, and an expert knowledge of all post production sound equipment -Director's main point of contact for everything concerning the production soundtracks -establish what sound effects are required throughout the production and to ensure that these effects are available Requirements -Must be computer literate and have a good working knowledge of sound recording, playback, editing and mixing equipment -Great understanding of Sonicsolutions, WaveFrame, Audiovision, and similar systems.
11201.title: Sound Editor!

11201.description: Job Description: Overseeing entire operations of the Fundraising Department. Continuing to keep the mission of the organization alive and fully support every aspect of the organization/company. Ability to manage a staff of 1-20 depending upon positions available. Continuing job description of Fundraising Coordinator, overseeing entire operations for Fundraising Department, including but not limiting to managing volunteers/interns, Fundraising Coordinator, etc. Responsibilities: - Manage, provide guidance to, and ensure accountability of AFB fundraising staff. - Ensure that the fundraising staff has clear and achievable objectives. - The resources and institutional support needed to carry out responsibilities; and positive and effective relationships with internal and external donors/sponsors and with counterparts in AFB - Develop a sound, achievable, comprehensive fundraising strategy to meet the goals for unrestricted and private restricted fundraising set by the President. Lead and coordinate the fundraising staff team to implement the plan efficiently and effectively. - Ensure that the fundraising strategy of AFB is adequately diversified and includes tactics in specific areas such as major donors, web based giving, foundations, corporate support, etc. - Collaborate with staff across the organization in order to ensure consistency in representing AFB to potential donors and other audiences. - Must continue support of AFB Mission and its goals. - Extending role of Fundraising Coordinator. - Must provide oversight of entire Fundraising Department, including but not limited to, interns/volunteers in any position, Fundraising Coordinator, Fundraising Budget Manager, Fundraising Material Specialist, etc. - Will Coordinate to expand and diversify AFB’s donor base, working closely with other volunteers/interns to secure proper funding. - Submitting Weekly, Monthly, Yearly goals and how the goals will be executed for the Fundraising Department. Competencies: - 2-4 year degree in Finance, Financial Accounting, Financial Management, Business Management, or 3-5 years experience in related field. - Proven record of continued/extensive team leadership skills. Ability to manage 1-20 employees. - Being able to work independently and also be a self motivated person. - Excellent Verbal and Written skills is required.
11201.title: VP of Marketing

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501 (c) 3 non profit organization dedicated to inspiring and nourishing children with cancer through the therapeutic form of the arts. A Free Bird helps children ages 4-18 achieve their DREAM and inspires them to continue with their passion for the arts! We are currently seeking an Experienced HR Associate for Nonprofits, someone who is experienced with HR related work and has a minimum of 4 months on their schedule to be available. Someone who has worked in the non profit world perferred but not required. This is a time when someone who is taking a leave from one job and wants to do something in their spare time, or has the experience and is not able to receive a job for right now. Anyone who is willing to be part of this position will work 10-15 hours per week and will be in charge of minimum 30 volunteers for events, daily tasks/assignments, and hiring new volunteers and interns. The organization is growing and we are excited to bring on new and incredible talent that can really help us get to the next level. If you are someone who is available to 10-15 hours per week Tues-Thurs has a passion to help children with cancer, knows the Human Resources Field, is computer savvy, is patient, and gets along with people, then WE WANT YOU! Come help us fight cancer through the arts and empowering every child to become FREE from their disease! Please apply with a RESUME to HR@afreebird.org
11201.title: VP of HR

11202.description: We are looking for young patrons for the Museum. Help plan events, meet new people and have lots of fun. This is a group for those 21 years old and older. Were you active in college and now working yet still interesting in planning and attending events? Looking for an exciting way to get back into some socializing and doing good at the same time. Considering joing our Young Patrons group. Interested applicants, please let us know.
11202.title: Young Patrons and Coordinators

11202.description: Video editor or AE to help edit webisodes. We have all the footage and need someone to come in once a week for a few hours to put it all together. The webisodes are short, less than 10 minutes. Filming as well using our equipment. We use Adobe Premiere.
11202.title: Video Editor Intern

11205.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. We are seeking a Marketing Intern who can commit 5-10 hours per week for minimum of 3 months (50 hours). Position is non-paid but can apply for school internship credit. This is not a filing and get coffee type internship. You will have REAL responsibilities and acquire marketable experience Responsibilities: Assist with daily project management of digital and traditional marketing, working with Marketing Coordinator on strategy, analytics and logistics Coordinate the working document to track projects cross-departmentally Assist in Managing timelines for e-appeals, campaigns, cultivations and optimizations (such as donor pages, homepage and confirmations); Assist with Managing timelines for vetting of direct mail pieces for six different appeals monthly; Assist with coordinating the Integrated Marketing Calendar of all fundraising and cultivation activities; Liaison with the Programs, Graphic Design/Web, Fundraising and PR departments Draft marketing copy for brochures, posters, presentations and other organizational collateral; Coordinate with the Graphic Design and Web department with copy for creative projects; Performing other responsibilities as may be required. Qualifications: Excellent writing and editing skills with ability to produce polished and compelling copy on tight deadlines Creativity in tapping and cultivating mainstream media and social networking communities A positive, energetic and proactive multi-tasker who can work independently or very collaboratively, as part of a team Ability to work effectively, efficiently, diplomatically and calmly in a high-pressure environment on issues that are often complex and politically sensitive Strong listener, with a high degree of professionalism and flexibility, including the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments in a timely fashion
11205.title: Marketing Volunteer

11207.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor.
11207.title: Literacy Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11207.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library
