11207.title: Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11207.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11207.description: You can empower a child to believe in themselves, and fulfill their potential. Genesis Homes is located at 330 Hinsdale Ave, East New York conveniently near the Subways L, 2,3,4,5. The mentoring program provides support to the residents children ages 8-14 through activities promoting healthy choices, leadership and building self-esteem. They will be meeting every other Saturday from 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM. Mentoring USA's mission is to create sustained and supportive mentor relationships for children in need ages 7-22. The program matches youth with trained adult mentors who can guide them in developing better self-esteem, creating healthy relationships, and making positive life choices. Mentors and mentees meet in a supervised environment at a set time and location. Mentoring USA partners with schools, community centers, foster care agencies, and other non-profits. All sites are supported by MUSA Program Managers who work directly with Site Supervisors at each location to ensure that the programs run smoothly. Contact: recruitment@mentoringusa.org 212-400-8290 All mentors must be 21 and older and willing to undergo a background check and screening. How to Apply: Complete the Mentor Application: http://www.mentoringusa.org/become_a_mentor/Mentor_Application
11207.title: You Matter! Mentor! in Brooklyn

11207.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11207.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 158, Brooklyn)

10027.description: Inspire NYC public school students to love reading Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our innovative programs, accomplished authors lead workshops in high-needs classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. No experience or training is necessary to work with pre-K-12 students. As a writing, research or art coach, you'll engage and encourage their progress on a project. This workshop needs your support at an elementary school in Harlem: Program 1542TH-PB Wednesday, March 8th, 2017 11:30 AM - 1:00 PM Writing Coach Second graders read The Bear Report by Thyra Heder, the story of Sophie, a young girl who befriends a polar bear named Olafur who teaches her about his home and life in the Arctic. Writing coaches will help them edit and polish the final drafts of their research reports about an animal of their choice.
10027.title: Inspire Harlem, NYC public school students to love reading

10027.description: The Harlem Arts Festival (HAF) works to continue Harlem's legacy of making art that preserves the history and develops the identity of the neighborhood. HAF provides resources, visibility, and career opportunities to Harlem-based artists, and increases participation in the arts by the Harlem community through year-round events, culminating in our free, weekend-long festival in Marcus Garvey Park in June. Check out our website http://www.harlemartsfestival.com/ to learn more about what HAF does. Our annual gala is HAF's second biggest event of the year, and we need your help! This is one of our major fundraising events, and its success is crucial to our ability to carry out our mission to support the incredible talents of Harlem artists. This year's gala will take place on Thursday, March 30 at the Riverside Church Assembly Hall in Harlem. We're looking for volunteers to give a few hours of their time to help us pull off the big event. Things volunteers might do include checking in guests, liaising with the performers, collecting night-of donations, and encouraging guests to bid on auction items. The dress code is semi-formal, and volunteers will receive dinner and opportunities for breaks. So if you can spare a bit of your time, come help make this year's HAF gala a smashing success. And of course, everyone at HAF is immensely thankful for whatever time you can give!
10027.title: Harlem Arts Festival - gala volunteers needed!

10027.description: We're looking for instructors who have the ability, fluidity, and patience to work with students in grades 6, 7, and 8 with instruction on app development, website development, robotics, or game development. You will be on the cutting edge of teaching computer science concepts, as less than 10% of New York City and Northern New Jersey public schools has a computer science curriculum! What's more, 10% of US schools have a computer science curriculum. You will utilize the existing creativity that already exists within the spirits of children, as well as their knack for apps and video games, and channel this energy into supporting them in learning wireframing, weibsite, app & game development. We operate within an afterschool model, in that schools and community based organizations utilize our expertise to provide quality programming to their students and program participants. Your schedule and availability will be matched with the school or community-based afterschool program. If you are into Scratch, Arduino, JAVA, or HTML, this is a PLUS. Come contribute your mastery to increase the interest in STEM in our students in Harlem!
10027.title: Scratch, HTML, JAVA Instructors Needed - NYC!

11208.description: For our Non-Profit organization we are looking to build and have volunteers work at our local High School called High School for Civil Rights. At this school we will be working directly with students during block times and during lunch times. Our volunteers will facilitate workshops for a book club, chess, job readiness and vocational training etc. We would also like to have volunteers to assist with our community center for the adults in the community where we offer job skills training, senior services to local senior centers, community advocacy and more.
11208.title: Youth Empowerment Program (10weeks)

07604.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07604.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07604.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07604.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07604.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07604.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07604.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07604.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

10024.description: Register at www.dorotusa.org Brighten the day of a senior! Deliver a package and visit with an older person. We offer three locations for DOROT orientation and assignments: West Side: DOROT 171 West 85th Street Off Amsterdam Avenue East Side: Central Synagogue 123 East 55 th Street, Between Park and Lexington Avenues Westchester: Congregation Emanu-El of Westchester 2125 Westchester Avenue, East Rye, NY Manhattan: DOROT deeply appreciates the generosity of Marilyn and Stanley Katz who help sustain our Passover Package Delivery Program. We are also grateful to the estate of Sanford H. Goldstein for its support of DOROT's Holiday Package Delivery programs. Support for the Passover Family Circle Program is made by the Pollak family in loving memory of Jason Pollak. This year’s Passover Package Delivery is enhanced through a special project of J-Serve 2017. Westchester: We are grateful to the following supporters of DOROT Westchester: US Department of Health and Human Services - Administration on Aging (AOA), New York State Office for the Aging, Westchester County Department of Senior Programs and Services; UJA-Federation of New York, Westchester Program Services Cabinet; and the Silverweed Foundation. Thank you to Congregation Emanu-El of Westchester for hosting the Passover Package Delivery.
10024.title: Deliver a Passover/Spring Package and visit with a isolated senior

10024.description: Please join us for a special intergenerational reading adventure for 2nd and 3rd graders and older adults. The program is ideal for youth who need extra encouragement to reach for a book and spend time discussing books. Nurture your child’s natural love of reading and chatting through a variety of fun and creative intergenerational activities. The group will read aloud a few books over the course of 14 sessions and discuss the major themes of the books respecting other’s differences and the value of kindness. Great food and art activities will follow. 2017 Dates: February 1 - orientation (for youth only) February 8, 15 March 1, 8, 15, 22 April 5, 19, 26 May 3, 10, 17, 24 Register online starting December 12. Only 12 spaces are available for youth. Parents need a pre-phone interview. For more information, please contact Shelley Levine at slevine@dorotusa.org. Please note: This program is only for students in 2nd and 3rd grade. We are not in need of teen or adult volunteers to assist in the program.
10024.title: Intergenerational Reading Adventure for 2nd and 3rd Grade Students

10024.description: Intergenerational Chess at DOROT Share your love of the game and bring a smile to a senior. \"One of the best things about playing chess with Mr. B is how excited we are to see each other.\" -Zach, age 13 Winter/Spring: Jan. 30-May 15 from 4:00-5:30pm Students and DOROT Seniors will get to know each other and play chess together. Refreshments will be served. Free. Requirements: for 6th - 12th grade students must commit to all sessions understand the game of chess understand the different chess pieces and how to move them Intergenerational Chess at DOROT is sponsored by the Targoff family and friends
10024.title: Intergenerational Chess - Youth Needed to Play Chess with Seniors

Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07601.title: Hospice Volunteer

08816.description: Position Summary: The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Volunteer Director of Social Worker is a part time position and will provide oversight to our social workers and mentors. Responsibilities: Coordinate, supervise and manage the fiscal, clinical and administrative functions for assigned departments. Develop and implement strategies that our mentors will use improve the social skills of our clients. Develop, implement and monitor compliance with departmental and organizational policies and procedures. Plan, organize and implement services to enhance patient care and/or improve fiscal and operational efficiency. Essential functions/working conditions: Ability to work in a team setting Strong social and interpersonal skills Comfortable with mentoring individuals with disabilities Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults and children with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more.. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement: Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of vendors and provision of services.
08816.title: DDD Program Administrator

11364.description: Summer Volunteer / Intern wanted for a drug education program based in Bayside, Queens. We need a summer volunteer / intern who can: 1) schedule events 2) be responsible for monitoring the schedule of our events, ensuring that everything is organized, etc. 3) Handle and maintain our database 4) prepare and send out newsletters 5) make deliveries of educational materials 6) man and set up booths at community fairs and events We are looking for someone who is reliable, organized, friendly and professional. If you are interested, please send your resume.
11364.title: Intern / Volunteer Wanted
11364.org: Foundation for a Drug Free World - NY Chapter

07724.description: My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. - A home where English is the primary language spoken -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
07724.title: Do You Have A Spare Room & A Big Heart?

10023.description: The volunteer will assist instructors in rehabilitation, pre-vocational and recreational programming for teenagers who are blind or visually impaired. They will be required to monitor the youth as they move between classes and provide support on field trips. This teaching assistant will primarily assist a student in the people mover - a light weight wheelchair - with transitioning between classes, organizing and the like. The ideal candidate will be male to assist with bathroom orientation. Duties and Responsibilities: * Comfortable pushing a people mover - a light wheelchair. * Escorting the student to classes, the restroom etc. * Assist with transfers to chair. * Assist instructors in classes such as cooking, physical education and art. * Guide students as needed to classes within the building or on field trips. * Assist instructors and student by bringing enthusiasm to groups. Qualifications: * Must have a positive helpful attitude that will allow this student to harness independence with the assistance of a travel guide. * Able to handle confidential information. * Able to arrive on time and be prepared daily. * Flexibility with task requests. * Interest in working with students with disabilities preferred. * Positive attitude and enthusiasm is a must! * Must be sighted guide trained. * Bilingual Spanish a plus! * Must be able to stand for periods of time if required. Details of the Opportunity: The volunteer will be instructed by each staff on how best to help the student participate in program activities. To volunteer, or for more information about this opportunity respond to this e-mail or call Rosie Lopez at (646) 874-8682. Please include a telephone number for follow up!
10023.title: Volunteer Needed Saturday With Teens in NYC!

07932.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07932.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07932.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07932.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07932.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.

10601.description: An AARP Tax-Aide Counselor provides free income tax form preparation and answers tax questions for low- and moderate-income taxpayers two or more days a week during the February to April tax filing season. You will be required to attend January training sessions on the tax code and tax software and to complete and pass the IRS take-home exam. Volunteers need to apply by early October in order to be scheduled for training. Familiarity with tax preparation software is a must for counseling, although administrative positions are available without that requirement. This is a great opportunity to help low-to-middle-income and older taxpayers in your community. To learn more about volunteering with AARP Tax-Aide check out our website: http://www.aarp.org/money/taxaide/
10601.title: AARP Tax-Aide Counselor

07087.description: Use your skills to help the immigrant community and experience the joy of helping someone change their life. We are looking for committed volunteers to teach Spanish speaking students. Volunteers teach one, three-hour class a week for ten weeks. All classes are on Sundays. Previous teaching experience is not necessary, but commitment, ability and a desire to teach are key. Our teachers have included those with experience, those undergoing teacher training and those who have no experience at all. Some classes require Spanish speakers, but some do not. Comite En Union para Salvadorenos (CEUS) is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization based in Union City, NJ that was founded by Central American refugees to help immigrants create a better life for themselves. The classes are now offered at Centro Comunitario CEUS, our community center 15 minutes from Manhattan. Our website is www.ceusnj.org. CEUS has organized ESL classes for 23 years.
07087.title: Teach English to immigrants - change your world and theirs!

07030.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org
07030.title: Special Olympics New Jersey - Young Athlete Program (Yoga & Group Activities), Hoboken

10012.description: The Bubble Foundation Volunteer Wellness Educators teach wellness classes to pre-K and elementary students in one of our partner NYC schools (currently in Manhattan- Harlem and Washington Heights, Brooklyn- Bedstuy and Brownsville, and Bronx- Mott Haven). Volunteers will use Bubble curricula to teach one or two interactive 45-min classes per week on topics relevant to food and health (e.g., cooking, nutrition, gardening, agriculture, food literacy). Wellness Educators are asked to commit to teach for the entire academic semester and will be paired with at least one co-teacher with complementary skills. We provide complete training to our volunteers. Throughout this volunteer experience, Wellness Educators will gain skills in: nutrition education, garden education, culinary arts education, cooking, teaching, classroom management, teamwork, public speaking, working with kids and underserved populations. Thank you for your interest in volunteering with Bubble! Visit our website to learn more and apply www.welcometobubble.org. Or use this form to apply: https://goo.gl/forms/kz12sztVwgtfLS3x1 Questions? Please contact: volunteer@welcometobubble.org.
10012.title: Nutrition, Cooking, and Gardening Wellness Educator

10012.title: Stop Food Waste and Feed the Hungry Every Monday & Tuesday In Soho. 3:00-3:30pm

07208.description: Do you have a special skill or talent? The Retired and Seniro Volunteer Program in Union County is seeking enthusiastic individuals to develop and teach enrichment classes such as arts & crafts, chess, knitting, music and creative movement. Also seeking volunteers to help children with homework. Volunteer opportunities are avaialble in Summit, Scotch Plains, Plainfield, and Elizabeth
07208.title: Afterschool Program Volunteers Needed
07208.org: Jewish Family Service of Central New Jersey

07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers should arrive an hour early to help with set-up and to receive some training on helmet bike and bike adjustment. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike!

06897.description: The American Cancer Society is seeking volunteers in to be a part of the annual Relay For Life of Wilton! Community volunteers lead and organize each local event with the support of Society staff. From assisting with planning the annual event to taking part the day-of, there are various volunteer opportunities for interested community members. Some of these opportunities include: -Entertainment/Activities -Ceremonies -Social Media -Publicity -Sponsorship -Fund-raising -Logistics -ACS CAN -and more! Volunteer opportunities can be flexible to your schedule! There is something for everyone! The Relay For Life program is a community-based event where teams and individuals camp out at a school, park, or fairground and take turns walking or running around a track or path. Each team has at least one participant on the track at all times and participates in raising funds to support the American Cancer Society’s mission to finish the fight against cancer. Four million people participated in more than 6,000 events worldwide last year. If you would like to join the Relay For Life of as a volunteer or team participant, visit us online at relayforlife.org/wiltonct, or contact your American Cancer Society Staff Partner, Lindsey Hanley at Lindsey.Hanley@cancer.org or 203.563.1514. Thank you! About the American Cancer Society The American Cancer Society is a global grassroots force of nearly three million volunteers saving lives and fighting for every birthday threatened by every cancer in every community. As the largest voluntary health organization, the Society's efforts have contributed to a 22 percent decline in cancer death rates in the US during the past two decades, and a 50 percent drop in smoking rates. Thanks in part to our progress nearly 14.5 million Americans who have had cancer and countless more who have avoided it will celebrate more birthdays this year. We're determined to finish the fight against cancer. As the nation’s largest private, not-for-profit investor in cancer research, we’re finding cures and ensuring people facing cancer have the help they need and continuing the fight for access to quality health care, lifesaving screenings, clean air, and more. For more information, to get help, or to join the fight, visit cancer.org or call us anytime, day or night, at 1-800-227-2345.
06897.title: Volunteers needed for the American Cancer Society Relay For Life of Wilton 2016-2017!

07039.description: We are looking for a very special volunteer to assist with the presentation of art lessons to primary and middle school students with special needs. Volunteer will work with a team of two other volunteers. Materials and lessons provided, you bring the pizazz! Volunteer must be high energy and animated during the presentation of lessons to capture the attention of children and to build excitement for the activity. Volunteer must also have the ability to switch gears when appropriate to show calm and patience while encouraging students in their efforts. Looking for a volunteer who is a natural at building people up! Organizational skills and clear-thinking are essential. Volunteer will need to bring class through a series of steps to create their artwork and disseminate supplies at key points while also tracking their usage. Volunteer will also be in charge of maintaining supplies. Volunteer will be needed for Tuesdays 12:30pm-2:45pm on the following dates: 1/31, 2/21,2/28, 3/14, 3/28, 4/4, 4/11, 4/18, 4/25, 5/2, 5/9, 5/16 (9:30am-12:00pm also available.) Availability for all Tuesdays is a must. This is a great opportunity for anyone with an art therapy background or a college student going into special ed or OT, SLP or PT (not a requirement.) No need to be a professional artist but you should consider yourself crafty and creative.
07039.title: art lesson assistant for classes with special needs

07039.description: What: A nationwide awareness and fundraiser campaign through the National Inclusion Project. When: The Holiday Season - The contact will send specific dates and times. Why: To help raise awareness and funds for the National Inclusion Project, spread holiday cheer, and have fun! Specific Dates/Times: Dec 6 and 12 from 9 am - 5 pm, Dec 16 from 9 am - 1 pm
07039.title: 2016 Wrapping for Inclusion- Livingston, NJ

10701.description: Mentor wil develop supportive, consistent mentoring relationship with a child through recreational play and paraprofessional therapeutic techniques. Help children explore and cope with social and/or family struggles. The Reach & Rise program has changes the lives of many young people in Yonkers. We want to continue that trend, but we can not do it without your help. Come and bring a revolutionary change to Yonkers youth and become a mentor today.
10701.title: Volunteer Mentor

10704.description: I am looking for volunteers in the following departments: Possible a retired CEO and CFO. Volunteers who are familiar with nonprofit laws, Nonprofit administration, Volunteers who can write a child care program, a grant writer, Volunteers who have experience in getting a summer camp started A volunteer who has experience in writing a school program Networking and branding... Web designing
10704.title: Children were born to LOVE us

10704.description: I need volunteers who know how to write a school program (goals, objectives, outcomes). I have the ideas but I need people who have experience in writing a school program to help me put it together. That could actually be a principal or teacher. I am also looking for people who are experience in nonprofit laws. Volunteers who have experience in managing grant contracts and/government contracts- that could be a COO or CFO an active or retired board member from a previous nonprofit. Volunteers that knows how to write a nonprofit grants. My request may be a tall order but I am sure your agency have the right people for me. Zion’s Place mission: Rescue, heal, nurture, protect children from childhood trauma - joining the ACEs (Adverse Childhood Experience) movement
10704.title: Building a better world

10704.description: Seeking a retired CFO or someone who is very familiar with Nonprofit organization.
10704.title: Nonprofit Administration or Finance CFO

11212.description: Grow Brooklyn is a nonprofit organization dedicated to preserving the assets and maintaining the financial security of New York residents. It is with this mission that we recognized the opportunity over 15 years ago to start a VITA program for the underserved Brooklyn residents. As Brooklyn’s largest noncommercial tax provider, we have grown to cover most of central Brooklyn along with southern Brooklyn. This is, in large part, thanks to our volunteer tax preparers. Volunteer Tax Preparers will be tasked with completing high quality tax returns for low- and middle-income Brooklynites. Our ideal tax preparer would have a high interest and motivation for building on their tax preparation experience. They should also have a passion for helping the members of our community who need it most. Most of all, our volunteers should be able to practice patience, good customer service skills, and have a great sense of humor! This is a great opportunity to build valuable work experience, meet new friends, and help people who need it. Benefits Wide ranging benefits include learning new skills or building on valuable professional experience with active work duties. We have served as professional references for many of our volunteers. Build a sense of achievement for directly positively affecting your fellow Brooklyn residents by providing them top quality tax service without the predatory service fees associated with retail tax providers. If that isn’t enough for you to sign up, we’ll also provide snacks. General Requirements All volunteers are welcome. An interest or previous experience with taxes is preferred so college accounting students as well as current and retired tax professionals tend to make up most of our volunteer pool. If you don't have any tax experience, no problem! We proide training. Training All tax preparers must pass the IRS Volunteer Basic Certification via the Link and Learn training module online. Advanced Certification is also welcome. Upon completion of Link and Learn, volunteers would then be provided hands on training session to prepare them for the tax season.
11212.title: VITA Volunteer Tax Preparer

11212.description: Make a difference in the life of a young person. Our YMI is a mentoring program for high school and middle school youths, especially young men in the Brownsville area. We are currently seeking mentors ages 21 and over with knowledge and/or experience in youth development and leadership to serve as mentors to our youths. Meetings would be held at our Seth Low Community Center (137 Belmont Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11212). Start and End Dates: December to August 2017. Time Commitment: An hour and a half per week meetings with mentees.
11212.title: Young Male Initiative (YMI) Mentorship Program

11213.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor.
11213.title: Literacy Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11213.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Empower youth and their families to get active in a neighborhood without many options. Got a few spare hours on the weekend from March to June? Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to build a league. Kids love it, but don't know the game. Help us create teams! We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. SCHEDULE - APRIL 1-JUNE 30 SATURDAYS, 12:45 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 3:45 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 11 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If youi're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. CAN YOU ONLY DO APRIL 1 OR APRIL 2 - help us do an open soccer day on the field. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas for Crown Heights Fest - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your backgrounds so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - Here's our pages: SEEDS IN THE MIDDLE BROOKLYN-CROWN HEIGHTS SOCCER Soccer for Harmony
11213.title: Soccer Players! Share joy of game with underserved kids, 4/1-6/30/17

11213.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor .
11213.title: Volunteer Information Session
11213.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11210.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11210.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS K315, Brooklyn)

11211.description: Dear Volunteer, This is an incredibly opportunity to participate in a live music event, while supporting a movement for change in the war on cancer. Sound Affects is a newly formed charity that has established a innovative crowdfunding model to support the advancement of cancer biotechnologies. We reach the crowd through partnerships with independent musical artists who help us raise awareness and funds for our cancer-fighting campaigns. (www.soundaffects.org) On Sunday, March 12, Sound Affects will launch \"Music Beats Cancer\" at the Music Hall of Williamsburg in Brooklyn, NY. The event will feature a mash up of performances from independent musical artists who support Sound Affects mission. See details here:http://soundaffects.org/events/ We seek volunteers to assist us the following ways: 1. Help promote event through social media and street flyers 2. Help set up banners and merchandise day of event 3. Assist with VIP checkin 4. Support sales of merchandise 5. Have fun! We really appreciate your interest and consideration! Sincerely, Mona Jhaveri Executive Director
11211.title: Music Beats Cancer

11216.description: Children of Promise, NYC (CPNYC) volunteers contribute time, talent or treasures towards the advancement of CPNYC and develop personal connections. The support exhibited by CPNYC volunteers is vital to the organization’s growth and health. The S.R.C. will be exclusively dedicated to expanding academic support and tutoring to our participants. These tutoring sessions will provide an additional pillar of support to each student and encourage educational engagement that supplements school-day learning. The S.R.C. will solely be supported by volunteers who will provide tutoring support in areas such as homework help, school assignments and projects as well as practice exercises in preparation for standard exams.
11216.title: Saturday Resource Center

11217.description: A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply : please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11217.title: Development Director

11217.description: Hello! We are currently seeking talented Grant Writers to help out A Free Bird with a few grants. We are a 501 (c) non profit dedicated to inspiring and nourishing children with cancer through the arts. Helping children from ages 4-18 we enroll them in Trumpet, dance, piano, modeling, lessons and many more! We are seeking a Grant Writer to help us with 2 grants. This would roughly take about 10-15 hours per week, and if you truly volunteer those 10-15 hours the grant could be done within 2 weeks. These are on a rolling basis for submitting a grant so the sooner the better! Please forward a resume to hr@afreebird.org. Any questions can be asked during the interview process. Thanks for your interest in A Free Bird!
11217.title: Grant Writer

11217.description: READ 718 is looking for volunteer literacy tutors. Volunteers must attend an orientation and one training session. We are currently recruiting for our Spring program ( April 19-June 22, 2017). READ 718 is a non-profit literacy center that provides afterschool tutoring and literacy workshops to low-income students in grades 3-8. We are looking for dedicated, reliable, caring, positive people who are committed to working with a child twice a week for 9 weeks (April 19-June 22), excluding Public School vacation dates. Tutors will be provided with easy-to-follow lesson plans for each session, and will have access to reading specialists for questions and guidance. Children who are behind in reading after grade 3 and do not receive the targeted instruction that they need simply fall further and further behind. READ 718 aims to provide students with high quality, supplementary instruction to bridge the gap between students who are struggling and their grade level peers. If you are interested in being a volunteer tutor, please visit our site and complete application at: http://read718.org/volunteer-application/
11217.title: Volunteer Literacy Tutor

07305.description: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. This is a great opportunity to donate your time and build your portfolio! Our events are well-run, organized, colorful and full of high-energy! All experience levels welcome! Volunteer Opportunities available on SATURDAY, APRIL 29 from 8:00AM - 2:00PM /SUNDAY, APRIL 30 from 8:00AM - 2:00PM. ß This will change based on walk site location. Our friends with MS need us now more than ever! Volunteer MS today!
07305.title: Volunteer Photographers Needed for Walk MS in Jersey City!
07305.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07305.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 8 AM - 12 PM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Clean-up Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 7 AM - 11 AM Clean-up: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. 8 AM - 2 PM Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. 8 AM - 2 PM For more information, visit: www.walkms.org
07305.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2017 Jersey City!
07305.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

11215.description: The Welcome Desk Ambassedor greets existing and new members of the Park Slope Center for Successful Aging in person and provides information over the phone. This is a perfect fit for a patient, good humored, detail-oriented volunteer who enjoys interacting with the public. Duties and Responsibilities: Provide a friendly, warm, welcoming environment for everyone who enters the center Assist members with lunch attendance check-in and ticketing procedures Provide information regarding events at the center and registration forms Answer Phones Use scanner and/or a computer for attendance tracking, activity entry Other duties specifically around communication and promotion of senior center meals and programming Qualifications: Must present a professional appearance and a friendly manner Must be dependable and punctual Be courteous and personable when dealing with Center members and the public Be willing to take initiative and detail oriented Respect and maintain confidentiality of the Park Slope Center for Successful Aging volunteers, clients, staff and partners Time Commitment: 10am-2pm FRIDAYS, a minimum of 3 month commitment required
11215.title: Welcome Desk Ambassador, Park Slope Center for Successful Aging

10035.description: The 14th Annual Colon Cancer Challenge would not be possible without the help of our wonderful volunteers. We have opportunities for all ages and groups. We need about 110 volunteers for Sunday, April 2nd to ensure a safe and fun day for all at the Colon Cancer Challenge! We have opportunities for everyone, including groups: distribute T-Shirts, pass out refreshments for walkers/runners, accept donations and so much more. To Sign Up: fill out the form here http://events.coloncancerchallenge.org/site/PageServer?pagename=CCC_Volunteer and click SUBMIT! Please feel free to call the Colon Cancer Challenge Foundation at 914.305.6674 or email at info@coloncancerchallenge.org with any questions or concerns. ** T-shirts - 10 volunteers 7:55 am - 12:00 pm Open t-shirt boxes and organize t-shirt by size. Distribute finisher t-shirts to individuals before or after the race.Collect pull-tab from bib when distributing t-shirt.Maintain an organized t-shirt tent and tables. ** Refreshments - 10 volunteers 7:50am - 12:00pm Pour coffee/water. Distribute fresh fruit to participants. Refill refreshments as needed. Maintain a neat refreshment area. ** Bag Check - 10 volunteers 7:50am - 12:00pm Must be organized. Obtain pull-tab from runner bib, affix tab to participant bag with safety pin. Place bag in correct checked area Locate correct bag upon participants return - only give bag to participant with matching bib number. ** Info Booth - 3 volunteers 7:45am - 11:00am Must have knowledge of event, site, course. Give information and proper directions/instructions. ** Kid's Fun Run - 5 volunteers 9:30am Assist event coordinator with assembling children prior to each Kid's Fun Run division. Distritbute medals to each particiipant. Assist coordinator with returning children to their parents safely. ** Directional - 12 volunteers 8:00am - 11:30am Must be familiar with event site and race course. Will be given a particular location at the event. Give proper directions/instructions. ** Set Up (Friday Noon - 5 PM) - 5 volunteers Assist event coordinator et up tables/chairs/supplies/banners etc. **Set Up/Break Down (Sunday) - 15 volunteers 8:15am - 11:00am/ 10:45am - 1:00pm Assist with inflating and weighing down start/finish arch. Assist with set up of Rollin’ Colon. Breakdown start/finish line and Rollin’ Colon **Water Stop - 10 volunteers - Fill cups at water stops before race starts and continue to refill as needed throughout the race. Maintain a neat water stop. **Course Marshals - 28+ volunteers Will be given a particular location along the race route where they will need to stay for the entirety of the race.Help direct runners in the proper direction. CLICK ON THIS LINK TO SIGN UP AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PAGE http://events.coloncancerchallenge.org/site/PageServer?pagename=CCC_Volunteer
10035.title: The Fourteenth Annual Colon Cancer Challenge

During the semester, you will prepare your students for the Spring Dance Recital taking place on June 17, 20017 at the United Palace Theatre. There are also other opportunities to perform at community events. At Groove With Me, we strive to provide an opportunity for girls to try something new, make new friends, and develop their self-confidence through dance. We create friendships that last a lifetime, girls who are strong in both body and in spirit, and skills that the girls can use both in and out of the studio. If you are interested you can call me at 212-987-5910 or reach me via email at beatriz@groovewithme.org Beatriz Coronel, MA Program Director Groove With Me, Inc. 186 E 123rd St NY, NY 10035 Phone: 212-987-5910 Fax: 212-987-5080 www.groovewithme.org

10035.description: Citizen Schools calls all citizens to go teach! Citizen Schools brings volunteers to middle schools to teach hundreds of relevant subjects--and launch new dreams. At Citizen Schools, middle-school students work side by side with experts to explore new fields, learn new skills, and create something real for their community. Once a week, volunteer Citizen Teachers partner with middle schools in low-income communities to teach apprenticeships in a wide range of subjects. Teams and individuals from corporations, civic organizations, universities, and associations lead courses about things they're passionate about, exposing young people to new futures through ten weekly lessons. Each curriculum is designed to make academic and 21st Century standards connect to careers and real life. And each one culminates in a WOW!--a presentation of the students' work before an adult audience, building students' oral communication and teamwork skills. Independent studies show that Citizen Schools apprentices get better grades, have better attendance, and graduate at a higher rate than their peers--and that volunteers gain professional skills like teamwork, communication, project management, and leadership. (And they appreciate their employers for the opportunity to give back!) Register your interest at: http:www.citizenschools.org/volunteer/sign-up/
10035.title: Use your passion, skills and knowledge to transform the educational landscape in NYC

11218.description: The Foundation for Letters promotes improved college access through engagement with writing by providing urban schools with a range of literary-focused academic and enrichment programs. We also provide schools with assistance in the development of their own external support organizations, which build networks of donors, volunteers and partners that support literacy-focused education at their schools. The Foundation is the official charity for the Brooklyn 5K/10k/15k in Prospect Park. We will be helping to administer the race, as well as raising funds to support our writing programs and partner schools. We are also getting kids into the action! Not only will students be running the race, but as a new journalism program at FFL, we will have students covering the action as journalists, photographers, bloggers, interviewers, and live social media correspondents. We are inviting folks to help us as race day volunteers to help out on the course, as volunteers with the kids, or to run or walk one of the distances (you can either run 5k, 10k, 15k or with a kid in the 2k kids race). The race will work just like a typical \"fun run\" for charity, but in the context of a large race. FFL's partners in organizing the Brooklyn 15k (Pacific Sports and Active Network), have given us a guaranteed number of entries into the race at all of the distances (so we're protected against a sell-out). To volunteer or to run to support the Foundation for Letters, reply to this opportunity! For more information, please contact Mike Jackson - mike.jackson@foundationforletters.org www.foundationforletters.org
11218.title: Volunteer on 4/16 @ Bklyn 5k: Have fun as a race volunteer & help students learn to be journalists!

10036.description: What will be expected of me as a volunteer? As a volunteer, you would be expected to help and mentor students by being interactive and supportive during the program when the students need help by having the opportunity to learn how to inspire students to be life-long learners. Some of the examples you may be assigned to do is mentoring students, setting up and cleaning up before and after the program. Do I need any special skills? No, you do not need to have any special skills. Our program incorporates a variety of team building activities that support our goal to engage students to work collaboratively. The result is that by volunteering you will benefit from the experience and come away with valuable skills. To learn more about the opportunity reach out to our team at events@we-connect-the-dots.org, to learn more about the program please visit our website at HTTP://CREATINGSTEAM.ORG

10030.description: Behind the Book works directly in New York City public schools, providing rich, innovative literacy programs to urban classrooms. Working with students from pre-K to 12th grade, Behind the Book identifies books that speak to students, then partners with teachers to create immersive curriculum units that bring the authors into classrooms. Through a series of workshops, authors discuss their book and teach a genre of writing, encouraging students to see themselves as readers and writers. Behind the Book seeks a Program Intern to assist with the design, implementation, and administration of our school programs. The intern will work closely with the Director of Programming and the Program Coordinators to support all aspects of our programs. The position is based in our Harlem office. The commitment is for one semester, minimum two days per week, hours are flexible. Responsibilities include: Working with students in classrooms Managing the Behind the Book library; conducting research and managing review copies Assisting with student book publication as needed Supporting staff with program logistics and administration Assisting in creating lesson plans, activities and worksheets for our school programs QUALIFICATIONS: Detail-oriented, eager to learn, and able to manage tasks independently. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English are required, as are strong skills in Microsoft Office. A background in education theory or previous teaching experience a plus. TO APPLY: Please submit a resume, cover letter, and a one-page writing sample to Jo Umans at info@BehindtheBook.org. \"Program Intern\" should appear in the subject heading of your email. Deadlines to apply for next two semesters: Spring 2017: February 13th Summer 2017: May 31st Behind the Book is committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, political affiliation, family responsibilities, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or local law. We are committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization, as we want to engage all those who can contribute to this effort.
10030.title: Program Intern

10030.description: Behind the Book works directly in New York City public schools, providing rich, innovative literacy programs in urban classrooms. Working with students from pre-K to 12th grade, Behind the Book identifies books that speak to the students, and partners with teachers to create immersive curriculum units that bring the authors into the classroom. Through a series of workshops, authors discuss their book and teach a genre of writing, encouraging students to see themselves as readers and writers. Learn more about Behind the Book on our website. Behind the Book seeks a Fundraising and Development Intern to assist the Development Manager in all aspects of fundraising. The position will be based at our Harlem office. The commitment is for one semester, for a minimum of two days per week. Responsibilities include: Researching prospective funders Assisting with donor communication, including thank you letters, appeal letters, and letters of inquiry to foundations Publicizing donations (and/or profiling donors) on Behind the Book’s website, newsletter and social media Assisting with database management (training on Salesforce provided) Assisting with promoting fundraising events. QUALIFICATIONS: Detail-oriented, eager to learn, and able to manage tasks independently. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English are required, as are strong skills in Microsoft Office. Strong research skills are a plus. Candidates interested in fundraising and philanthropy are strongly encouraged to apply . TO APPLY: Please submit a resume and cover letter, along with a two-page writing sample to Kara Matthews at kara@behindthebook.org. \"Fundraising & Development Internship\" should appear in the subject heading of your email. Deadlines to apply for next two semesters: Spring 2017: February 1st Summer 2017: May 31st Behind the Book is committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, political affiliation, family responsibilities, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We are committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization, as we want to engage all those who can contribute to this effort.
10030.title: Fundraising & Development Intern

10030.description: Behind the Book works directly in New York City public schools, providing rich, innovative literacy programs in urban classrooms. Working with students from pre-K to 12th grade, Behind the Book identifies books that speak to the students, and partners with teachers to create immersive curriculum units that bring the authors into the classroom. Through a series of workshops, authors discuss their book and teach a genre of writing, encouraging students to see themselves as readers and writers. Behind the Book seeks a Social Media Intern to work with our Development Manager to coordinate a range of social media platforms. The position is ideal for a go-getter with a strategic mind and excellent communication skills who wants to be an integral part of implementing BtB’s social media strategy. The position will be based at our Harlem office, with a commitment is for one semester, a minimum of two days per week. Responsibilities include: Developing and posting social media content on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other social media platforms Updating BtB’s blog (WordPress) regularly with new content that features stories and pictures from our school programs and other news of interest from our organization Selecting and editing pictures, student work, and videos related to our programming for the blog, social media, and newsletter QUALIFICATIONS: Detail-oriented, eager to learn, and able to manage tasks independently. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and experience with social media sites required. Experience with WordPress and Mail Chimp a plus. TO APPLY: Please submit a resume and cover letter that includes some ideas about BtB’s social media to Kara Matthews at kara@behindthebook.org. \"Social Media Internship\" should appear in the subject heading of your email. Deadlines to apply for next two semesters: Spring 2017: February 1st Summer 2017: May 31st Behind the Book is committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, political affiliation, family responsibilities, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We are committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization, as we want to engage all those who can contribute to this effort.
10030.title: Social Media Intern

10030.title: EVENT Organizer

10030.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10030.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 175 Henry Granet, Manhattan)

07746.description: Description BGCM! (Because God Chose Me!) Community Center & Sportsplex, is a 501c3 nonprofit academic, arts & athletic center for youth & families founded on Christian principles, and is dedicated to instilling in each member that they have been specifically chosen by God to do magnificent things! We specialize in improving the self esteem of youth and families in surrounding suburban as well as underrepresented and underprivileged communities. We promote integrity and stewardship, and offeran innovative opportunity to train, excel, and compete academically, artistically, and athletically. THIS OPPORTUNITY IS TO HELP BENEFIT YOU! We are seeking a SUPER FANTASTIC experienced Assistant who will produce work that will directly affect the growth of our organization while also gaining experience in areas which are important to you. The Assistant may also have a huge hand in assisting with grants and development tasks and more. Benefits of working with BGCM: * Gain professional work experience, while also meeting personal/professional goals. * Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship that has a global impact. * Learn about the industry from all levels of BGCM management. * Network with other for-profit and nonprofit professionals in an open office environment. * For students, class credit can be arranged according to school requirements. Department: Administration Status: Intern/Extern or Volunteer Number of Positions Available: 2-3 On-site (and virtual at times) Facility Address: Monmouth Worship Center, 37 Vanderburg Rd, Marlboro, NJ 07746 Responsibilities Provide support to CEO/President as described herein this job description. Responsible for various specific and general projects in a fast paced environment. Candidates may be asked to assist with special programs, events, or projects. Some or all of your responsibilities may include: * Identify three professional or personal goals in which you want to gain exposure in or work on and work with President/CEO on gaining experience in said areas. * Providing President/CEO with accurate, confidential, professionally written materials including memos, correspondence, meeting minutes, reports, agendas, manuals and handouts. * Taking ownership of President/CEO’s extremely active calendar and tasks assigned to assistant and following said tasks from inception to conclusion. * Taking initiative and being proactive, in completing tasks while often removing items from President/CEO’s to-do list and completing them. * Taking notes during every meeting or discussion in both physical and virtual meetings with President/CEO and others. * Act as site manager and assistant manager of programs and staff. * Maintaining flexibility as workloads change and participating in early morning or evening meetings as well as special events as required. * Performing special projects and other duties as assigned. Requirements * Mentoring is available; extensive training for day to day responsibilities is unavailable; candidate MUST work proficiently with a great level of autonomy. * Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, and excellent computer skills. * Possess exceptional skills in presentation, interpersonal relations, and customer management. * A passion for youth and a heart to serve. * Enrolled in a certificate or Bachelors or Masters Degree Program (preferred) in business administration, organizational leadership, psychology, public affairs, communication, or a similarly related field of study. * Independent, open-minded, enthusiastic, adaptable, and must be able to work in a team environment, independently, and with a great deal of autonomy. * Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs. * Must be assertive and pay meticulous attention to detail and utilize strong critical thinking skills. * Based on experience, position may start as unpaid position, with the potential to transition into a part-time or full-time paid position within the company. ALL APPLICANTS MUST: Email references and resume to chosen@bgcme.org and visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about our organization.
07746.title: IMMEDIATE OPENING: Assistant to the CEO/President – Intern/Extern or Volunteer
