Responsibilities * Manage site and communicate with students and/or parents and staff on a daily basis. * Manage staff to ensure order and classes are on schedule. * Open and close facility as needed. * Assist with entering data, ordering supplies, tracking attendance, and other tasks. * Ensure site is clean, safe and functioning. * Ensure equipment and snack bar is setup, restrooms are clean and facility is well maintained. * This includes but is not limited to dish and trash duties, mopping, and sweeping. * Ensure facility is free from roaming students and report any unusual activities. Requirements * Mentoring is available; extensive training for day to day responsibilities is unavailable; candidate MUST be a self-starter and work proficiently with a great level of autonomy. * Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, and excellent computer skills. * Exceptional prioritization, leadership, presentation and management skills. * Passion for youth and a heart to serve. * Must be assertive, pay meticulous attention to detail, and utilize strong critical thinking skills. * Enrollment in a certificate or degree program or employment in business administration, organizational leadership, psychology, public affairs, communication, or a similarly related field of study is a plus. * Project management skills are a plus. * Based on experience, position may start as unpaid position, with the potential to transition into a part-time or full-time paid position within the organization. ALL APPLICANTS MUST: Email references and resume to chosen@bgcme.org and visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about our organization.
07746.title: IMMEDIATE OPENING: Site Manager

08820.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
08820.title: Hospice Volunteer

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers or side walkers for our Spring Semester! Lessons run Monday through Thursday from 2:30 to 6 PM. Volunteers can choose from 1 to 3.5 hour long shifts. Our Spring Semester begins on March 5th and runs through to June 15th. (Only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as horse leader.) We are also looking for volunteers to help out with our morning school groups. Schedule will be emailed with application. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Springtime Volunteers needed for Therapeutic Horseback Riding!

07302.description: The rock CAN roll organization invites you to volunteer with us at The Fest For Beatles Fans! rCr volunteers will be talking about hunger collecting healthy nonperishable food items (for people & PETS) from event participants. Upcoming dates: Fri 3/3/17 4pm-9pm Satuday Shifts: 03/04/17 12n - 4p and 4p-9pm Sunday 03/05/17 12n - 4pm

07735.description: We are looking for volunteers for our 5k Race as well as in the few months leading up to it. Different roles based on what you or your group might be interested in helping with. Higher-level leadership roles with our committee also available for the right person... Some of the areas we would like more volunteers for: *Awareness & outreach to Running Community & local colleges *Support Group (Teal Buddies) *Recruiting Runners/Walkers to form Teams! *Recruiting Exhibitors for the event (Women-related/healthy living & nutrition-related/fitness-related, etc.) *Recruiting entertainment * Recruiting Sponsors -leverage existing relationships to help make introductions for NOCC with comanies that may have interest in our work in New Jersey * \"Day Of\" Helping with set-up & OR Break-down
07735.title: 5k Run/Walk-Liberty State Park,NJ

10038.description: We are looking for volunteers with dance experience to help run a weekly movement-based creative workshop for students with intellectual disabilities in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn, Wednesdays from 11-12. This opportunity takes place over 12 weeks, for a small group of middle and high school students. The workshop will culminate with an informal showing. We are also looking for volunteer yoga instructors in all boroughs.
10038.title: Looking for Dance Teachers and Yoga Instructors

10038.description: Join Reach the World’s 2017 Benefit Committee! Reach the World is a New York City-based nonprofit organization that makes the benefits of travel accessible to classrooms, inspiring students to become curious, confident global citizens. Every year since 2001, Reach the World has held an annual benefit to fundraise for the organization. The guest count is typically between 150 and 200 guests from diverse New York City and Connecticut-based industries. The event includes cocktails, a silent auction, a sit-down dinner, and an award presentation at the end of the evening. This year's Cronkite Award will be given to the most prominent honoree in RTW's history - stay tuned for the big reveal! The success of Reach the World's events are entirely dependent on the volunteer Benefit Committee members whose work and creativity make the event possible. Volunteering for RTW is a substantive way to gain event experience, network with other NYC professionals, and give back to a good cause. Reach the World welcomes all serious applicants to the 2017 event committee. The 2017 benefit will take place in March 2017 at the Boathouse in Central Park! The committee will meet at Reach the World's downtown or midtown office weekly in the evening, starting January. In addition, the committee will host team-building activities throughout the season. Applicants must commit to attending meetings and networking with other committee members. Applications are competitive; incomplete applications will not be considered. Thank you for your volunteer spirit and desire to help ensure that all youth have access to global experiences that prepare them for college and careers in the 21st Century! To apply for this volunteer opportunity, please copy this link into your browser and complete the online application: https://www.tfaforms.com/455003
10038.title: Benefit Committee: Volunteer to Help Youth Reach the World

10038.description: Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Program Food Bank For New York City’s free citywide tax assistance and financial services program helps low-income families and individuals take a significant step from food poverty toward self-sufficiency. And we rely on volunteers to support this impactful anti-poverty work. In the last 15 years, Food Bank’s tax program has put more than $1 billion back into the pockets of hardworking New Yorkers who are unable to afford expensive accountants and tax services. Through the support of IRS certified volunteer tax preparers, Food Bank is able to offer the same expertise and professionalism - free of charge. Transition your financial skills into goodwill, and help thousands of low income New Yorkers receive free tax refunds and credits that can stabilize their lives and while bringing in more funds into New York City. In 2016 alone, each volunteer secured an average of $35,000 in refunds for New Yorkers in need. If you are interested in participating in the upcoming 2017 tax season, please visit http://volunteer.foodbanknyc.org/taxes. Req ui rements Volunteers commit to a weekly shift (at least 3 hours per week) from January through April at one of our partner sites throughout the five boroughs. Follow these easy steps below to become a tax preparation volunteer: Create a volunteer account on our website. Pass the basic or advanced level Link & Learn exam on the IRS website anytime between November and early January, and email us your test results: IRS Form 13615. We'll confirm receipt of your results & send you a link to sign up for training. After training, you'll receive your site placement according to your preferences & become a certified volunteer tax preparer! Once you've been trained, you'll commit to a weekly shift at a tax site in manhattan, Brooklyn, The Bronx, Queens, or Staten Island where you'll be a resource for clients to depend on for the tax season from January until April. Upon completion of the program, all volunteers will receive a certificate from the IRS recognizing their contribution. Eligible students may also receive school credit. Upon completion of the program, all volunteers will receive a certificate from the IRS recognizing their contribution. Eligible students may also receive school credit. About the Food Bank Food Bank For New York City has been the city’s major hunger-relief organization working to end hunger throughout the five boroughs for more than 30 years. As one of the country's largest food banks, our mission is to end hunger in New York City by organizing food, information and support for community survival and dignity. As the city's hub for integrated food poverty assistance, the Food Bank tackles the hunger issue on three fronts - food distribution, income support and nutrition education - all strategically guided by its research. Have questions? Email us at taxvolunteer@foodbanknyc.org
10038.title: Food Bank Tax Preparer: Tax Assistance Program
10038.org: Food Bank For New York City

10038.description: Hamilton-Madison House is looking for volunteers on Saturdays from 11:00am till 3:30pm to help tutor and teach kids, ages 6-17, Math and Literacy. This is a great opportunity to gain valuable teaching experience as well as inspiring a love of learning in children. Program started October 2016 and will run until June 2017.Volunteers must make a one month commitment.
10038.title: Are you good in math and reading?Become a tutor for a group of lively and humorous 6-17 year-olds

10038.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10038.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 126 Jacob August Riis, Manhattan)

07642.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07642.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07642.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07642.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07642.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07960.description: We are beginning to recruit interested volunteers for our upcoming New Jersey Confidential Sexual Violence Victim Advocate (CSVA) training, which is slated to begin in February 2017 (Tuesdays and Thursdays from 6PM-10PM). During the 40 hour training, volunteers are educated about topics regarding sexual assault statistics, prevention, and response. Crisis intervention and advocacy support skills are taught and guest speakers, including law enforcement, military experts, and mental health professionals, present information. When the volunteer completes the training and receives the CSVA status, they are required to manage the crisis hotline for three 12 hour shifts per month. (The hotline is forwarded to the volunteer's telephone for their shifts.) In addition to hotline, the advocate's second responsibility per shift is to accompany survivors of sexual assault to the hospital as needed. Although this is a challenging volunteer position, the experience is very rewarding (and looks great on a resume too)! Join our team and support survivors!
07960.title: Sexual Assault Response Team Advocate Training

07960.description: Preschool Advantage relies on our volunteers to fulfill our goal of funding preschool education for local children in need. Volunteer on our event committees, updating our website, social media calendars, PR, database maintenance, special projects/mailings, Spanish language translator needed, spreading the word about our organization or general office duties assisting the staff at 62 Elm Street office. Whatever your skill set, there's a job for you. If you want to make a big difference in the life of a local child, please don't hesitate to email me, with any questions. Our hours are 9 to 5 pm Monday - Friday, unless during event time.
07960.title: Sharing your Talents and Making a Difference in your Community!

Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07621.title: Hospice Volunteer

07643.description: Education Coach Internship Description: Under the direction of the MFSC Staff, Homework coaches will work with children from K-12 to provide academic support. Homework Coaches will be coaching a group of 5 children similar in age. The coaches’ primary responsibility is to ensure that the children have completed their work accurately as well as assisting them when needed. This is a part-time volunteer position. Homework coaches should have previous experience working with children; however relevant coursework will be considered. This position is a good fit for an aspiring teacher or youth worker with a background in working with kids. Internship Requirements: Interns must be flexible, may require some nights and Saturdays Internship is Unpaid Interns are able to create their own schedule, including hours per week and monthly commitment Currently enrolled in college or currently has Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with relevant coursework and or previous work with children Comfortable with children and all/most subject areas from Elementary to High school Strong communication, organizational, and professional demeanor MFSC will work with College/University if credits/hours are required; however, this requirement is not necessary for an internship position with the MFSC
07643.title: Education Coach

07628.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07628.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07628.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07628.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07628.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07628.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07660.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 8 AM - 12 PM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Clean-up Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 7 AM - 11 AM Clean-up: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. 8 AM - 2 PM Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. 8 AM - 2 PM For more information, visit: www.walkms.org
07660.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2017 in Ridgefield Park!
07660.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07660.description: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. This is a great opportunity to donate your time and build your portfolio! Our events are well-run, organized, colorful and full of high-energy! All experience levels welcome! Volunteer Opportunities available on SUNDAY, APRIL 30 from 7:00AM - 3:00PM. Our friends with MS need us now more than ever! Volunteer MS today!
07660.title: Volunteer Photographers Needed for Walk MS in Ridgefield Park!
07660.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

10029.description: We're looking for several people to volunteer with our Meals on Wheels program on Saturday, March 11th! We welcome both individual volunteers and small groups. For over 40 years, Union Settlement has provided Meals on Wheels to East Harlem's older residents that are often economically struggling and living alone. Our Meals on Wheels program currently serves approximately 450 homebound seniors each day, and as of May 31, 2016, we have provided 143,313 meals to homebound seniors. Prior to the volunteer date, volunteers will be sent a short training video and brief quiz to help prepare them for participation with Meals on Wheels. Volunteers will help pack hot and cold meals and then join staff on deliveries where they will get to hand out meals to our clients and interact with the East Harlem community. When: Saturday, Mar. 11th from 9am to 12:30pm Where: Jefferson Senior Center, 2205 First Avenue (at E. 113th St.) Interested individuals or groups should email volunteers@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Saturday, Mar. 11th Meals on Wheels Volunteer\".
10029.title: Volunteer with Meals on Wheels on Saturday, Mar. 11th!

10029.description: 5 volunteers are needed to read a story chosen by the teachers to a group of students or a class. After reading the story, the guest reader engages the class in a discussion about the book.
10029.title: P.S. 182 Guest Reader Thursday!

10029.description: We're excited to announce that our 19th annual Concern Spring Run will take place on Saturday, April 8th, 2017 at 9:30am in Central Park! The Concern Spring Run is a grassroots fundraiser here in NYC. Starting in 1998, the run has grown to welcome over 1,000 participants who run, jug, or walk the 4 mile course in Central Park. All funds raised enable us to continue helping those living in extreme poverty acheive major inprovements in their lives. We are lucky to have such a great team here in our NYC office but we can't do it without the help of our amazing volunteers! Today we are asking for your help to ensure that the Concern Spring Run can once again be a success. Email us with the following details if you are interested in volunteering: 1. Name: 2. Email: 3. Cell Phone #: 4. School or company: 5. Have you volunteered at the Spring Run before? If so, when? 6. Will you be volunteering alone or with a group? If with a group, please provide the number of individuals and their contact details.
10029.title: Volunteer for Concern's 2017 Spring Run in Central Park!

10029.description: We need an Office Assitant to help our in various LSA programs, inlcuding Development and also our Early Childhood program. Help with a multitude of tasks to help support our Development Office and/or Early Childhood Parent and Child Development program. Duties may include organizing projects, assist as may be needed in a very busy office environment that support parents at children at the LSA Family Health Service. Computer skills not necessary; just need someone who likes to help out as needed in a busy office environment. Hours: flexible: 2 - 3 hours two days a week. Please contact the Volutneer Director for more details tgough@lsafhs.org
10029.title: Office Helper Needed!

10029.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10029.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child(East Harlem Tutorial Program, Manhattan)

10029.description: Urgent! We need caring, responsible Child Care volunteers to assist with toddlers (age 15 months - 3 years old) while their mothers are in counseling sessions or counseling groups. Times available: Thursdays 9 - 12 am; also 4 hours flexible during the rest of the week. Must enjoy working with toddlers, engaging in developmental play.
10029.title: URGENT: Child Care Volunteers Needed!

11226.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor.
11226.title: Literacy Volunteer Information Session
11226.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11226.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. 11226.title: Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11226.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11226.description: Position Description: Maa Sa Akhi Performing Arts Academy seeks a Development Assistant to provide administrative support for the Director in all aspects of Maa Sa Akhi development. This role requires solid people management expertise. The Development Assistant must be a flexible and engaging individual who can analyze and prioritize tasks and build trusting relationships for the effective achievement of results. This person will report to and get approval from the Director before implementing any new procedure or changing any policy. As a member of Maa Sa Akhi’s development team, the Development Assistant will work closely with the Director, as well as other Maa Sa Akhi staff, faculty, and Board members to assist in the administration, coordination and implementation of all development activities. The ideal candidate will be interested in nonprofit arts administration and fundraising, and be passionate about the mission of Maa Sa Akhi Performing Arts Academy : to help each student realize their innate excellence through the performing arts toward success in their every endeavor.
11226.title: Development Assistant, Part-Time
11226.org: Maa Sa Akhi Performing Arts Academy

11225.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our innovative programs, accomplished authors lead workshops in high-needs classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. No experience or training is necessary to work with pre-K-12 students. As a writing, research or art coach, you'll engage and encourage their progress on a project. This workshop needs your support at an elementary school in Crown Heights: Program 241KCL-C Wednesday, March 8th, 2017 9:00 - 10:00 AM Art Coach A kindergarten class read Stuck with the Blooz by Caron Levis, a picture book that helps children talk about emotions by depicting them as friendly monsters. Students will meet with the author to explore ways to handle their feelings, then choose an emotion to write about and illustrate. Art coaches will help small groups stay focused, provide support and encouragement, and oversee clean-up by students. For details about other Behind the Book programs around the city, visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new volunteer opportunities, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
11225.title: Inspire Crown Heights, Brooklyn public school students to love reading

11225.description: The Foundation for Letters promotes improved college access through engagement with writing by providing urban schools with a range of literary-focused academic and enrichment programs. We also provide schools with assistance in the development of their own external support organizations, which build networks of donors, volunteers and partners that support literacy-focused education at their schools. The Foundation is the official charity for the Brooklyn 5K/10k/15k in Prospect Park. We will be helping to administer the race, as well as raising funds to support our writing programs and partner schools. We are also getting kids into the action! Not only will students be running the race, but as a new journalism program at FFL, we will have students covering the action as journalists, photographers, bloggers, interviewers, and live social media correspondents. We are inviting folks to help us as race day volunteers to help out on the course, as volunteers with the kids, or to run or walk one of the distances (you can either run 5k, 10k, 15k or with a kid in the 2k kids race). The race will work just like a typical \"fun run\" for charity, but in the context of a large race. FFL's partners in organizing the Brooklyn 15k (Pacific Sports and Active Network), have given us a guaranteed number of entries into the race at all of the distances (so we're protected against a sell-out). To volunteer or to run to support the Foundation for Letters, reply to this opportunity! For more information, please contact Mike Jackson - mike.jackson@foundationforletters.org www.foundationforletters.org
11225.title: Volunteer on 4/16 at Bklyn 5k: Have fun as a race volunteer & help students learn to be journalists!

10025.description: BECOME A SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING and MATH (STEM) VOLUNTEER! Help middle school and high school students develop a passion for math and science by becoming a dedicated instructor, teaching assistant, or afterschool tutor. Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for the Spring 2017 session . The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school students and high school students . With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City . As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers! Our ideal volunteer is enthusiastic about working with youth, can commit to multiple Saturdays, and possesses, at minimum, basic science and math skills. No previous education experience is required. Your passion for science and math coupled with a desire to help New York City youth realize their true potential is all that is required.
10025.title: Spring & Summer 2017 - S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program

10025.description: Top Honors is a non-profit educational organization that provides free math tutoring to NYC 6th, 7th, and 8th-graders. Tutoring takes place on Saturdays and Wednesday evenings at a school on the Upper West Side. New volunteer orientation and training sessions take place on a rolling basis. To receive an invitation, please submit an application here . Frequently asked questions about the TH volunteer experience can be found on our website . All tutoring sessions take place on the Upper West Side in Manhattan on the following days and times: Session 1: Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m. Session 2: Saturdays from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Session 3: Wednesdays from 6:30 p.m. to 8 p.m. Volunteers may be professionals, advanced high school, college, or graduate students (community service credit is available). Applicants should be available on Saturdays for two hours starting at 10 a.m. or 1:00 p.m. or on Wednesdays from 6:30 - 8 pm, like math, and enjoy working with students in the middle school age group (10-14 years). No prior experience is necessary. A note on volunteer commitment: Tutors attend 2-3 Saturdays from October and May, which includes holidays and school breaks. Attending 20 out of 24 scheduled sesions will meet this requirement. To apply, submit an online application at www.tophonors.org/volunteer. Upon receipt, Top Honors will contact the candidate directly.
10025.title: Do you love MATH? Volunteer MATH Tutors needed!

10022.description: Sparkidz is looking for qualified and positive volunteers to come in on Saturdays and assist teachers with various activities including: yoga, computers, dance, music, drama, cooking and more. Volunteers will attend activities from times between 10:15am-3:30PM and have the option of participating in the morning, afternoon or the full day. All volunteers will receive a brief orientation before the start of the program. Requirements Sparkidz is looking for volunteers to assist teachers and group leaders with various classes that are offered. Volunteers would accompany students to and from their classroom activities. Volunteers would be asked to come to at least two Saturdays a month for either the morning, afternoon or full day of programming. Volunteers must be 16+ with no criminal background and they will asked to fill out an application and fingerprinted.
10022.title: Join our team!  We offer uniquely designed recreational programming for children with special needs.

10022.description: FRIENDS OF ART & DESIGN HIGH SCHOOL \"FAD\" NEED VOLUNTEER TUTORS!! Do You Love Art, Architecture, Film, Animation, Photography, Graphic Design, Cartooning or Fashion? Well, all our students do and they need help in tutoring. Seeking individuals to assist/mentor TALENTED students in grades 9-12 with MATH (geometry, Trig, or algebra), Global Studies, History, Sciences, English and test prep. Work with one or two students at a time. DAYS: TUESDAY; WEDNESDAY and THURSDAY TIMES: Tutoring is during the Students lunch hour. 4th period 10:44-11:28; 5th period 11:32-12:36; 6th period 12:20-1:04 & 7th period 1:08-1:52 ANY QUESTIONS, please email us at info@friendsofartanddesign.com Please visit our website at www.friendsofartanddesign.com to learn more about our organization, and the various projects we help Art and Design with.
10022.title: Tutoring Talented High Schoolers

And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07631.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

10020.description: WE Day is coming to Radio City Music Hall in New York for the first time, and we are looking for dynamic and engaging volunteers to help make this unique event possible! WE Day is the celebration of the WE Movement, an ocean of people coming together to create impact. Watch the WE Day video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eqtzsIEn-lg Why join us as a volunteer? Meet new people Earn volunteer hours Gain skills and experience in the realm of live events Witness inspirational speakers and performers Be a part of an amazing movement empowering young people to make a difference There are opportunities for youth, adults, families, friends and co-workers Event Details: WE Day New York Welcome - Thursday, April 6, 2017, 7:30 am - 2:30 pm WE Day New York Welcome: Friends & Family - Thursday, April 6, 2017, 4:30 pm - 9:15 pm Learn More: For more information on the roles available or to register, please visit WE.org/volunteer. You can also contact our amazing team at wedayvolunteers@we.org.
10020.title: Volunteer @ WE Day New York - Make a difference and inspire!

10021.description: The Carter Burden Center for the Aging (CBCA) is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Center's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBCA can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. The Carter Burden Luncheon Club oversees meal delivery to homebound senior citizens living in the Upper East Side of Manhattan. Meal delivery volunteers not only provide the advantage of a daily lunch to our seniors, but are able to interact with those they are benefitting face-to-face. Each meal delivery also serves as a status check and a friendly visit for seniors who are often unable to leave their home and receive few, if any, visitors. Meals are delivered on foot to clients living between 69th and 79th Streets, between Fifth Avenue and the East River. Volunteers may deliver individually or in groups. Volunteers should be able to carry 5-10 pounds and walk up several flights of stairs comfortably. We are looking for Meal Delivery volunteers available on Thursday March 23rd 2017 from 10:15am to 12:30pm. We are happy to accommodate individuals, families as well as groups. If you are interested, please contact us at: volunteer@carterburdencenter.org
10021.title: Meal Delivery volunteers needed!
10021.org: The Carter Burden Center for the Aging

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premiere human services providers, is a 122-year-old settlement hours that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 20,000 people in need each year on the East Side of Manhattan. We are seeking volunteers to assist older adults improve their skill in using technology in two settings: Computer Practice Lab for All Levels (Group Setting) Mondays, 3:00-4:30, 1/23/17 - 3/20/17 Individual Technology Help for All Levels (One-on-One Setting , Wednesdays, 1:00-3:00, Ongoing
10021.title: Help Older Adults With Technology Skills

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighboirhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 122-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 20,000 people in need each year, ages 3 to 103, on the East Side of Manhattan. Our English as a Second Language program provides high quality, interactive instruction to a diverse student body. We seek to increase students' language skills, confidence in speaking and comprehension of English. Volunteers are needed to teach beginner level English classes to adult learners. Volunteers willl teach one class per week on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday or Friday, 9:30-12:00. Classes run January 17, 2017 - March 24, 2017 and are held at 331 East 70th Street in Manhattan. Training and supervision are provided but volunteers are responsible for preparing weekly lesson plans for their classes and writing brief summaries of student progress.
10021.title: English as a Second Language Instructor

11219.description: The role of a volunteer at Maimonides Infants and Children’s Hospital is to provide supplemental service to the staff and to fill the multiple needs of the child and family while in the hospital. Volunteers at Maimonides Infants & Children’s Hospital are assigned by the Department of Volunteer Services and while on duty are directly responsible to the Child Life Supervisor/Designee. Child Life volunteers are prepared to function independently providing play, recreational, and supportive activities to children and their families on the Pediatric unit they are trained to. These activities assist in making patients feel safe and comfortable. Volunteers serve in the playroom as well as at the bedside when requested. Specific Volunteer Opportunities Available: Skilled Group Leader - If you have a special skill you would like to share with our families like music, singing, arts & crafts, knitting, scrapbooking, storytelling, puppetry, etc. ( 2 hours a week for at Least 6 months) Volunteer in Play Room or Teen Room- Help provide materials at bedside and play or do arts and crafts with children and teens in the play areas.( 4 hours a week for at least 6 months)
11219.title: Playroom Volunteer

Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers

07644.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.

11428.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11428.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS Edward M. Funk Elementary, Queens)

07306.description: My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. - A home where English is the primary language spoken -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
07306.title: Host Families Needed for International High School Students

11354.description: Status: Accepting Applications - Ongoing Project L.E.A.R.N- Adult Tutoring Program Are you seeking to develop your teaching skills for a career in education? Build your resume by completing volunteer service hours? Become more involved in your community or to share your knowledge or skills in technology? Then this volunteer opportunity is for you - learn more about how you can make a difference in the lives of victim-survivors of domestic violence today! How to Apply: Please send your resume to volunteer_associate@kafsc.org and complete our volunteer application form here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdmEp-K8bU7L-b4N2-EHLIfioD1vQ0c_Rb475CvBkKhAy2Dsw/viewform Please feel free to contact Carmen Wang, Volunteer Engagement Associate for any questions or concerns at volunteer_associate@kafsc.org or (718) 460-3801 ext. 36. Program Description The Self-Sufficiency Program at the Korean American Family Service Center (KAFSC) provides those who are affected by domestic violence basic job-readiness skills to enter today’s workforce and to gain employment. As part of our eight-week program to help clients become self-sufficient in their everyday life, our instructors teach English and Computer classes during the winter, fall, summer and spring semesters. Volunteers will provide one-on-one or group tutoring sessions to students who need help with homework, to learn the materials covered in class, or to practice and retain their knowledge. Also, tutors may develop their own or create new teaching lessons for students! Volunteer Title: Computer Tutor Summary of Position Teach students one-on-one on how to use a computer, internet or program, such as Microsoft Word or Excel. Tutors will assess whether a student is in the beginner, intermediate, or advanced level of computers and then teach according to their needs. Repetition and patience will allow our students to remember what they have learned. Responsibilities Provides one-on-one computer tutoring for adult students. Follow-up with students who are currently taking computer classes to help them review what they have learned in class or to catch up on their lessons. Track student progress by documenting what they have learned or need to work on in the next tutor session. You may develop your own instructional curriculum/materials to teach job search and resume writing materials that may not be introduced to students in their classes. Create a safe learning experience for all students Required Qualifications Ability to keep ALL personal information that students shared with you confidential, such as their names and where they live (avoid sharing information with friends, family & social media) Trustworthy and respectful Bi-lingual in Korean and English is preferred, but not required At least 21 years old or older with no criminal background Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Office 2010 (Word and Excel) Knowledge navigating computers with Windows 10 operating system Internet Savvy (write emails, use search engines, etc.) Schedule/Time Commitment Begins January until June 2017 (tentative dates) Commit at least four months of volunteer service Meet with students at least once a week for up to 1 hour outside of classroom time when classes are in-session and during semester breaks May spend additional time to create lesson plans Attend a bi-weekly meeting (10-20 minutes) with Volunteer Coordinator after a tutor session. Have a flexible schedule; Monday to Fridays, 9:30 am to 4:30 pm OR be available for at least one day of the week Location KAFSC Physical Address (Confidential) *A confidential agreement form must be signed before you can begin volunteering. Why Volunteer at KAFSC? *** By volunteering for at least four months at KAFSC, you are choosing to help our clients gain self-confidence, dignity, and economic self-sufficiency, so they no longer have to depend on their domestic violence abusers. Additionally, some benefits of volunteering for you include: Invitation to our annual Volunteer Appreciation Party, where you can meet and network with other staff and volunteers Add volunteer experience to your resume and gain new references Letter of recommendation for school or work Letter to confirm your hours of participation Presidential Award Service (PVSA) Certificates are awarded to those who are U.S. Citizens. *** References and letters are made available only upon request and only after you have completed at least four months of volunteer service. Thank you for your interest in volunteering at KAFSC! About KAFSC Founded in 1989, the Korean American Family Service Center (KAFSC) is a leading, nonprofit organization that supports and empowers adults, youth, and children to lead safe and healthy lives based on dignity, compassion and mutual respect. We are committed to preventing and ending domestic violence and relationship abuse, and creating a violence-free society. Our counseling, education and advocacy programs for individuals and families in the New York Tri-State area are provided in a culturally and linguistically appropriate setting. Through the historical merger with Rainbow Center of NY (aka Women in Need Center) in January 2014, KAFSC has increased capacity to add and provide an emergency shelter for women and children, the only-of-its-kind in the greater New York Korean community.
11354.title: Computer Tutor (Project L.E.A.R.N - Adult Tutoring Program)

11354.description: Status: Accepting Applications - Ongoing Project L.E.A.R.N - Adult Tutoring Program Are you seeking to develop your teaching skills for a career in education? Build your resume by completing volunteer service hours? Become more involved in your community or to simply share your love and knowledge of English? Then this volunteer opportunity is for you - learn more about how you can make a difference in the lives of victim-survivors of domestic violence today! How to Apply: Please send your resume to volunteer_associate@kafsc.org and complete our volunteer application form here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdmEp-K8bU7L-b4N2-EHLIfioD1vQ0c_Rb475CvBkKhAy2Dsw/viewform Please feel free to contact Carmen Wang, Volunteer Engagement Associate for any questions or concerns at volunteer_associate@kafsc.org or (718) 460-3801 ext. 36. Program Description The Self-Sufficiency Program at the Korean American Family Service Center (KAFSC) provides those who are affected by domestic violence basic job-readiness skills to enter today’s workforce and to gain employment. As part of our eight-week program to help clients become self-sufficient in their everyday life, our instructors teach English and Computer classes during the winter, fall, summer and spring semesters. Volunteers will provide one-on-one or group tutoring sessions to students who need help with homework, to learn the materials covered in class, or to practice and retain their knowledge. Also, tutors may develop their own or create new teaching lessons for students! Volunteer Title: English Tutor Summary of Position Provide one-on-one or group English lessons on grammar, pronunciation, spelling, everyday life phrases, and etc. Tutors will identify students’ specific needs and what they have to practice to gain English-proficiency. Ability to communicate clearly and slowly for students to understand is essential. Responsibilities Provides one-on-one or English group tutoring/conversations with 2-3 adult second-language learners in one setting. Follow-up with students who are currently taking English classes to help them review what they have learned in class or to catch up on their lessons. Track student progress to document what they have learned or need to work on in the next tutor session. You may develop your own instructional curriculum/materials to teach resume writing or job interview skills that may not be introduced to students in their classes. Create a safe learning experience for all students Required Qualifications Ability to keep ALL personal information that students shared with you confidential, such as their names and where they live (avoid sharing information with friends, family & social media) Trustworthy and respectful At least 21 years old or older with no criminal background Currently enrolled in college as a student OR have completed your bachelors/ master’s degree OR have two or more years of experience teaching English Attended our Volunteer Orientation Preferred Education/Skills: Bi-lingual in Korean and English is preferred, but not required College degree in English or TESOL is preferred, certification in ESL/ESOL is a plus Prior experience teaching adults or children Possesses a friendly demeanor and patience for students to learn at their own pace Able to communicate to students clearly so they understand your instructions Have a sense of empathy towards victims or individuals who have experienced trauma Schedule/Time Commitment Begins January until June 2017 (tentative dates) Commit at least four months of volunteer service Meet with students at least once a week for 45 minutes to 1 hour outside of classroom time May spend additional time to create lesson plans Attend a bi-weekly meeting (10-20 minutes) with Volunteer Coordinator after tutor session Have a flexible schedule; Monday to Fridays, 9:30 am to 4:30 pm OR be available for one weekday Location KAFSC Physical Address (Confidential) *A confidential agreement form must be signed before you can begin volunteering. Why Volunteer at KAFSC? *** By volunteering for at least four months at KAFSC, you are choosing to help our clients gain self-confidence, dignity, and economic self-sufficiency, so they no longer have to depend on their domestic violence abusers. Additionally, some benefits of volunteering for you include: Invitation to our annual Volunteer Appreciation Party, where you can meet and network with other staff and volunteers Add volunteer experience to your resume and gain new references Write a letter of recommendation for school or work Write a letter to confirm your hours of participation Presidential Award Service (PVSA) Certificates are awarded to those who are U.S. Citizens. *** References and letters are made available only upon request and only after you have completed at least four months of volunteer service. Thank you for your interest in volunteering at KAFSC! About KAFSC Founded in 1989, the Korean American Family Service Center (KAFSC) is a leading, nonprofit organization that supports and empowers adults, youth, and children to lead safe and healthy lives based on dignity, compassion and mutual respect. We are committed to preventing and ending domestic violence and relationship abuse, and creating a violence-free society. Our counseling, education and advocacy programs for individuals and families in the New York Tri-State area are provided in a culturally and linguistically appropriate setting. Through the historical merger with Rainbow Center of NY (aka Women in Need Center) in January 2014, KAFSC has increased capacity to add and provide an emergency shelter for women and children, the only-of-its-kind in the greater New York Korean community.
11354.title: English Tutor (Project L.E.A.R.N. - Adult Tutoring Program)

07016.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org

07012.description: Good day, Today's Learning Center is private school with almost 40 years experience in the process of converting to REACH Charter School of Clifton for 2016-2017. The board is scheduled to hold an initial meeting in late February contingent on intial approval from the NJDOE. More information: www.todayslearningcenter.org and www.facebook.com/reachcharter Below is a brief summary of our application: For almost 40 years, our unique mission has been to: 1) Educate the Whole Child Engaging Curriculum -Field Trips -Swimming -Music -Art -Violin -Theater After-school programs: gardening, Rotary Interact, sports, dance, tutoring & more 2) Develop Strong Parent/Community Engagement PTO, frequent communication, monthly family events and performances 3) Provide Individualized Student Support Student Support Team works with teachers to use student portfolios to create personalized learning programs 4) Integrate Technology to Support All Areas of Study Each student has a device, Smartboard access, online learning programs We will remain in our exceptional facility with access to: -500-seat theater -Swimming pool -Gymnasium -Playground -Baseball/Sports Field -Library/Media Center -Large Cafeteria Over half of our diverse student body resides in Clifton and Passaic with one-third qualifying for free/reduced lunch. Last year our school scored in the 89th percentile on a national standardized test. We find that many local families are unable to pay our already low tuition. Converting to REACH Charter School will offer Clifton and Passaic families a choice and allow us to serve more children in the community AT NO ADDITIONAL COST TO TAXPAYERS OR FAMILIES. We are looking for applicants qualified in ANY of the following areas: School leadership, administration, and governance; Curriculum, instruction, and assessment; Performance management; Parent and community engagement; Professional development; General operations; Facilities management; Financial management; and Fundraising and development; If you are qualified and interested in making a difference in the lives of families and children, then please email me for further information.
07012.title: Charter School seeking Board Member
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Hi! We are a small private school in desparate need of a sports coach for an after-school program. We have a beautiful 7-acre facility with swimming pool, baseball field, soccer/football field, basketball gymnasium, weight room, and fitness studio. Our kids already love soccer, but they are itching to play any kind of sport. If you have skill in any sport and would like to help kids learn, then please contact us! Thank you!
07012.title: After-school sports coach
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Hi! We are a small private school in need of an assistant to help with our brand new basketball program. No experience necessary, but it is helpful. We have two coaches, so you would be working with small groups of students and during scrimmages. The program is on Tuesday 3:15-4:15. Thank you!
07012.title: After-school Basketball Coach
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Calling all artists (or helpers)! We need your help to enrich the life for our students who can't get enough art instruction. If you have artisitc ablitiy and would like to share it with our students after school, then please contact me. You would be working with older students, regular and special education, on more advanced art techniques (oil painting, sketching, drawing, etc.) We need someone on Mondays 3:15-4:15 to work with about 10 students. Supplies would be paid for by parents. Thank you.
07012.title: Art Enrichment after-school
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07011.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07011.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07011.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07011.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07011.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07011.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07011.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07011.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

11238.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor.
11238.title: Literacy Volunteer Tutor Inforamtion Session
11238.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11238.title: Volunteer Information Session
11238.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11238.description: After School Instructor Achievement First Endeavor ES - Brooklyn, NY Chess Teacher We are seeking an enthusiastic and knowledgeable Chess player to volunteer to teach elementary school scholars the game of Chess. The ideal volunteer will work with students interested in learning the game of chess and building strategies for the game. If long term, the volunteer will prepare a group for a Chess Tournament at the end of the school year. The volunteer will help Achievement First Endeavor Elementary School achieve their goal of preparing students for academic success using Chess as a vehicle for building critical thinking and developing problem solving skills. The ideal volunteer must have a love for chess and the desire to share and teach young kids. Requirements & Commitment: Background check & finger printed One day a week from 4:30-5:30 pm from March 15 th - June week of June 9 th Previous experience teaching young kids
11238.title: After School Chess Teacher

11238.description: AF Endeavor Elementary School seeks a part time instructor for our Encore After School program in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, NY. The participants in the program are 100 students in KG-4 th. The goal of our program is to provide the academic and social support needed to help students develop the skills required to successfully complete their secondary and collegiate education. We achieve these goals by providing a holistic program that includes homework assistance, physical exercise, and fun extracurricular activities. The hours of this position are one day a week from 4:30pm-5:30pm. Rate of Pay: $20 per hour for a maximum of 2 hours per week. Major Duties and Responsibilities include: -Provide leadership on a day to day basis for a class of 10- 15 elementary school students. Instructors are representatives of our school and are responsible for maintaining the culture of our school in the afternoon. -Create lesson plans in advance of implementation ensuring that they are age appropriate and coincide with the goals of the program and our stakeholders. Much of our planning is based in exploration activities. Staff will work as a team to provide activities and experiences that increase student’s awareness and keeps their attention. -Ensure student safety and attendance to the program at all times. -Instructors are a role model for our students. Everyone on our team must be outstanding in adherence to policies on attendance and punctuality, dress code, and setting a tone of respect in interactions with students, colleagues, parents, and AFE staff members. -Communicate with parents when there is a concern that must be resolved. Provide excellent customer service and a professional, caring demeanor. Education and Experience: Study plan towards college graduation with a BA (minimum) At least one year of experience working with Elementary School age group in a professional setting Commitment to the program through the end of June 2017 is a non-negotiable requirement Bilingual fluency in Spanish and English is needed but not required Demonstrated Abilities Knowledge of best practices in working with children in an extracurricular setting Strong communication abilities in one-on-one meetings and in group settings, Takes personal accountability for the program outcomes, and takes initiative to implement positive change in the face of challenges Interested and qualified candidates should respond to this posting with their cover letter and resume by email only. Any attachments should be in PDF or MSWord formatting. Please include the title of this position in the subject line of your email. For more information about our organization please visit our website at www.achievementfirst.org Job Type: Part-time Salary: $20/hour Required experience: Work with elementary school students in a school setting: 1 year Required language: Spanish preferred
11238.title: After School Spanish Teacher
