07607.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.

06906.description: Telephone support volunteers assist staff with making phone calls to our patients and their families for follow up and offer emotional support to assist patients and their families with whatever the needs are after signing on to hospice care.. If you are a person who demonstrates the ability to communicate with people effectively, listens to others, has absolute integrity and the use of good judgment to handle the professional and confidential nature of assignments, then Caring Hospice of Connecticut located in Stamford, Connecticut is the right fit for you. Caring Hospice Services of Connecticut is a unique, holistic and cost effective service designed to meet the social, emotional, spiritual and physical needs of their patients and families in Fairfield county who reside in private homes, nursing homes and assisted-living facilities as they face terminal illness. We are looking for individuals who enjoy helping people, and are willing to commit to a consistent schedule a few hours per week or every other week. Individualized training is provided free of charge. In keeping with Medicare requirements, background and medical checks are part of the training process.
06906.title: Enjoy listening?  Become a telephone support volunteer!

06906.description: Caring Hospice Services of Connecticut is a unique, holistic and cost effective service designed to meet the social, emotional, spiritual and physical needs of their patients and families in Fairfield County who reside in private homes, nursing homes and assisted-living facilities as they face terminal illness. Office support volunteers help our staff with basic tasks such as answering the phone, copying and assembling packets, helping with web research, and more. If you are a person who demonstrates the ability to communicate with people effectively, has absolute integrity and the use of good judgment to handle the professional and confidential nature of assignments, then Caring Hospice of Connecticut located in Stamford, Connecticut is the right fit for you. We are looking for individuals who are willing to commit to a consistent schedule a few hours per week or every other week. Individualized training is provided free of charge. In keeping with Medicare requirements, background and medical checks are part of the training process.
06906.title: Enjoy answering telephones? Become an office support volunteer!

Data entry office support volunteers help staff with web research, data entry and working with spreadsheets. If you are a person who demonstrates the ability to communicate with people effectively, has absolute integrity and uses good judgment to handle the professional and confidential nature of assignments, Caring Hospice of Connecticut located in Stamford, Connecticut is the right fit for you. We are looking for individuals familiar and comfortable with the Microsoft Office Suite who are willing to commit to a consistent schedule a few hours per week or every other week. Individualized training is provided free of charge. In keeping with Medicare requirements, background and medical checks are part of the training process.
06906.title: Enjoy data entry and computer work?  Become an office support volunteer!

06902.description: We have a gentleman here who is a true veteran and would love to sit and have a conversation with another veteran. He waits weekly for others to join him however nobody does as they have other interests. He begins each meeting by putting his hat on and patiently waiting to see if anyone comes to join him. The \"meeting\" time is 11:00 on Thursday mornings here at Brighton Gardens. if you'd like to get to know him and share you story, please contact me. Thank you.
06902.title: Devoted Veteran Looking to Share his Story with another Vet.

06903.description: EVENT PLANNERS NEEDED Looking for an outlet for your creative ideas? Then this is the volunteer job for you. The Stamford History Center (also known as the Historical Society) is recruiting interested individuals to help plan our events each year. We need dedicated, organized people to help with hospitality, marketing and communication, ad and donation solicitation, finding sponsors, finding event locations, decorations, set up/break down, check in, support for regular events (such as our annual gala), and help in the creation of new events at our History Center. Contact Pam Coleman to express your interest: info@stamfordhistory.org. We have not yet established a regular meeting day and time, but will do so around the schedule of interested volunteers.
06903.title: Event Planner

06901.description: Seeking volunteer transport drivers with reliable vehicles to help us move dogs along our transport route between these towns: Hagerstown MD, Mechanicsburg PA, Hamburg PA, Phillipsburg NJ, Haskell NJ (northern NJ), Stamford CT, E Hartford CT. Transports are on Saturdays and we move through these towns during afternoon/evening hours. MUST LOVE DOGS. Must be comfortable handling strange dogs that may or may not be stressed by transport. Attention to detail important. Not above cleaning up stinky messes to help our furry friends get to safety. Crates are required but not provided. On occasion we are able to get some crates donated. Please submit a driver application: http://form.jotform.us/form/50214993744156
06901.title: Saturday transport driver near Stamford CT

10467.description: Sunrise on Wheels is a once a week, in hospital opportunity whereby volunteers bring a camp like play program to children while they are undergoing chemotherapy and other treatments. Our program consists of toys, games, puzzles and weekly themed craft projects. Sunrise on Wheels volunteers should be 18 years of age or older, and able to work in a hospital environment with children. We require consistency and a long term commitment.
10467.title: Sunrise on Wheels Hospital Volunteer

10467.description: R.A.I.N., Inc. is recruiting 60 community members to be part of a new and very exciting Bronx Health Corps project aimed at educating 800 Bronx seniors on a range of health topics. The Bronx Health Corps is part of a Geriatric Workforce Enhancement Program grant designed to promote wellness and healthy aging among Bronx older adults. This project is a partnership between the Hartford Institute for Geriatric Nursing (HIGN) at the NYU Rory Meyers College of Nursing, Montefiore Health System and R.A.I.N., Inc. The primary role of a Bronx Health Corps volunteer is to educate Bronx older adults on one of the following health topics: Asthma Management Healthy Diet, Exercise, and Stress Management Living with Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias Healthy Heart Diabetes Management Volunteers will select one of the above topics and then receive training on the selected topic. This training will equip the volunteers to provide education sessions for older adults at a Bronx-based senior center or community site. The material will be engaging, interactive and fun! Prior knowledge of these topics is not required. Training for the volunteers is slated to start in the Spring of 2017. The educational workshops will be carried out over 18 months in three cycles: January to May 2017, July to November 2017 and January to May 2018. Volunteers will need to be available during normal business hours (Mon-Fri 9am-4pm) The Bronx Health Corps project is a unique opportunity to help improve the health outcomes of Bronx older adults. Unfortunately, Bronx County is ranked last among all 62 counties in terms of population health. You can make a positive, perhaps even life-altering, impact in the lives of the Bronx’s older adults, by volunteering. Please take the first step and obtain an application via email. We look forward to hearing from you. Together we can make a difference!
10467.title: GWEP Bronx Health Corps Community Volunteer Educator
10467.org: Regional Aid for Interim Needs, Inc. (R.A.I.N.)

08837.title: Social media savvy or more traditional ?  We need you!

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 217 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

10469.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our innovative programs, accomplished authors lead workshops in high-needs classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. No experience or training is necessary to work with pre-K-12 students. As a writing, research or art coach, you'll engage and encourage their progress on a project. This workshop needs your support at an elementary school in the Bronx: Program CIMA0215 Tuesday, March 7th, 2017 8:15 - 9:15 AM Research/Writing Coach This 10th-grade class read Marc Aronson’s Sugar Changed the World to learn the interesting cultural history of sugar. The author will lead two classroom workshops tracing the history of the product from its use in religious ceremonies to its role in the slave trade. With the support of coaches, students will embark on their own research project and report. For details about other Behind the Book programs around the city, visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new volunteer opportunities, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10469.title: Inspire Bronx, NYC public school students to love reading

10469.description: By delivering free tax preparation to community college students and their parents, NHS of North Bronx hopes to help them access tax credits and refunds which can be used towards tuition, thereby increasing their chances of staying in school and securing gainful employment. The Tax Preparer will provide basic tax return preparation for eligible taxpayers at NHS of North Bronx tax sites in neighborhoods around the Bronx and Manhattan. S/he will establish the greatest degree of public trust, providing free high-quality service and upholding the highest of ethical standards. No previous tax preparation experience necessary; all training will be provided. This is a great opportunity for candidates interested in finance, auditing or accounting and who enjoy making a positive impact on others.
10469.title: VITA Tax Preparer

10469.description: I'RAISE Offers an exciting and rewarding opporunity to individuals seeking to become a role model and make a positive impact on younger youth. This exciting opportunity includes one on one mentoring, group mentoring and/or mentoring. Mentors work with mentees on developing goals for their life that will help them make social, emotional and educational gains! Ideal candidates include college students. students who need internship experience/volunteer experience, retired professionals or individuals who simply want to make a difference! If you are seeking an opportunity to invest in a youth and make a positive difference.

11798.description: Do you want to educate, motivate and have a blast all while volunteering to promote healthy living and well-being? There is an opportunity waiting for your encouraging voice and energetic personality. You would get the chance to offer your services of Yoga, Tai chi, Pilate's, Floor Exercise Routines, Nutrition Information or Aromatherapy for those living with mental illness or substance abuse issues. This is a great opportunity to teach those who suffer from substance abuse, other coping mechanisms and ways to reduce stress naturally. It is also a great way to build experience in your field.
11798.title: Health and Wellness Professional Volunteer

11793.description: Voices Against Brain Cancer will host our Annual Join the Voices! Long Island 5k Run/Walk on Saturday April 22 at Jones Beach Park. Registration for this charitable event will begin at 8AM and then at 9AM we will begin our 5k Run and 3K scenic walk in the park. There will be activities for kids, prizes and family fun for all. Funds raised will go towards the advancement of brain cancer research, as a testament of hope for the people in the world who are diagnosed with brain tumors. Local patients, doctors and caregivers will be honored for their valiant fights against brain cancer. We need volunteers to help us make sure it’s a great day for our participants and honorees. ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL GET A FREE TECH MATERIAL T-SHIRT! Volunteers will help with: - General event operations - Event day registration - Food and beverage distribution (Simple coffee, bagels, bananas and water) - Course Marshalling (giving participants directions) - T-Shirt distribution - Award Medal distribution - help with kids activities - help with \"Fight Wall\" signiture gathering. If you are interested, please contact Kevin Directly at : kevinogborn@voicesagainstbraincancer.org
11793.title: Help Fight Brain Cancer at the Join The Voices! Annual Long Island 5k Run/Walk!

07470.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07470.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07470.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07470.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07470.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07470.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07470.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07470.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07470.title: Hospice Volunteer

11791.description: What will be expected of me as a volunteer? As a volunteer, you would be expected to help and mentor students by being interactive and supportive during the program when the students need help by having the opportunity to learn how to inspire students to be life-long learners. Some of the examples you may be assigned to do is mentoring students, setting up and cleaning up before and after the program. Do I need any special skills? No you do not need to have any special skills. The most important skill or requirement is the desire to help students learn and motivate them to be successful. You will come away with new skills such as learning about Unity and engineerng design skills that you can apply in the workforce. Our program incorporates a variety of team building activities that support our goal to engage students to work collaboratively. The result is that by volunteering you will benefit from the experience and come away with valuable skills. To learn more about the opportunity reach out to our team at events@we-connect-the-dots.org, to learn more about the program please visit our website at HTTP://CREATINGSTEAM.ORG
11791.title: Volunteer for CreatingIDEAS 2017

08901.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org
08901.title: Special Olympics New Jersey - Young Athlete Program New Brunswick

08902.description: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. This is a great opportunity to donate your time and build your portfolio! Our events are well-run, organized, colorful and full of high-energy! All experience levels welcome! Volunteer Opportunities available on SUNDAY, APRIL 30 from 7:00AM - 3:00PM. Our friends with MS need us now more than ever! Volunteer MS today!
08902.title: Volunteer Photographers Needed for Walk MS in North Brunswick!
08902.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

08902.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 8 AM - 12 PM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Clean-up Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 7 AM - 11 AM Clean-up: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. 8 AM - 2 PM Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. 8 AM - 2 PM Please remember that volunteer groups (Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, church groups, school service clubs, etc.) are always welcome!!! For more information on Walk MS and volunteering, please visit: walkms.org
08902.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer @ Walk MS 2017 in North Brunswick!
08902.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter
